reviews: Can. Murky orange golden. Smells not like fish, even though the can pretends. Wood. Creamy, wood. A beautiful edge; nice drinkability.

355ml can. Consumed from the can, so I can't comment on the pour. Aromas of tropical fruit, pine and grapefruit. Strong resin and tropical hops up front, caramel malt, grapefruit finish. Very nice IPA.
A fine balance IPA that offers a nice drinkable session that doesn’t distract you. Slight tannin bitter at the end. Still great to have
16oz Can. A nice well-balanced IPA. Aroma of grapefruit and slight sweetness. Taste is more grapefruit rind with some bitter. An easy bitter finish. Glad I picked this up for a try

Can at the Airbnb, first beer of the trip. Why is it this hard to find anything in stores that’s not sold in at least six packs ot not a double IPA in tallboys? Anyway, it pours cooper with an off-white head. Nose and taste are resin, biscuits, citruses and grass with a hint of orange peel. Moderately bitter, somewhat sweet and sticky. Pleasant old school AIPA.

Bottle from 101 bottles, Kent, OH. Well, the 2nd best IPA in the world, and........I'm not convinced to be honest. Lovely clean hop forward aroma. Copper gold with slight haze. Taste is quite hop forward but not biting. The ending is all rather soapy in its bitterness and booze, I really don't like that ending. Middling IPA imo.

Pours a clear yellow-orange with a full creamy white head that leaves lacing. Nose is pine and citrus. Mouthfeel is full. Taste is malty, citrus. Bitterness is very low in the aftertaste. It is balanced.  12 oz can
Hazy golden/amber beer with a slight off-white head. Medium aroma; taste starts medium sweet and ends slightly/medium bitter and dry. Caramel, orange, pine, hops and citrus. 7/3/7/4
35.5cl blik. Helder goudgeel kleur, fijne romige witte. De geur is ananas en karamel. Smaak is zoet, citrus, ananas en karamel. Medium body en veel koolzuur.

#17 Beer republic advent calendar. Pours unclear dark amber golden with a creamy head. Lots of caramel and roasted malt, maple syrup and honey, resin, spicy hops, grapefruit zest, toffee, orange juice, herbal notes. Malty sweetness, dry hoppy bitterness. Full bodied, oily texture, soft carbonated, hoppy bittersweet finish. A classic West Coast IPA, rather malty.

Good but simple. Reliable APA but nothing to be amazed at. Bronze/amber color and I'd guess a low IBU for the bitterness is just simply not there. It has more of a malt flavor imo. I did get this in a can and unfortunately I do taste a hint of metal so I'm letting it sit longer to fully enjoy it. I do like this beer but what I really want to try is the IIPA they came out with but at $18 for a pack...  stay tuned
From a can. Hop-loaded IPA, but not bitter. A good bit of orange or clementine in addition to the grapefruit. Malt body holds up as well for balance. Really good.

Una cerveza de color naranja-ámbar con una espuma blanca y buena retención.

Ofrece un aroma muy complejo: floral, cítrico, resinoso y un poco de toronja.  Aparecen algunas notas de caramelo. 

En el sabor se nota la malta, sabores de galletas y caramelo combinan bien con los cítricos del lúpulo. El amargor se siente al final y limpia el paladar y lo prepara para el siguiente sorbo.

El final es seco como cítrico y caramelo, el alcohol está bien enmascarado.
Can at London Craft Beer Festival.  Clear orange.  Nice and piney nose.  Really bitter and classic.  Very tasty.

Orange amber color beneath a soap like size bubble white head. Effervescence on the sides clings in lacing. Citrus aroma and agreement with the advertised grapefruit description. Quick bitterness on the palate. Hop taste forcefully expressed onto the tongue. Expect some pushback with your tastebuds. The bitterness units seem countable. Finish is strong but the alcohol subtly creeps up on you to even things out.
Tastes like somebody marinated a light wheat ale in orange rinds. Probably wouldn’t again

Clear amber/copper body with a big foamy and persistent white head. Aroma is malty (caramel), melon and citrus notes. Taste is malty with a pleasant hoppy kick made of resinous and citrus notes. Bitter finish. Medium body soft carbonation oily texture.

Bottle. Copper with a foamy white head that has fair retention and ample lacing. The aroma is light and features grapefruit, pine and mango. The taste has a big grapefruit presence with pine and caramel malts. Palate is full and smooth with lively carbonation. Overall: decent.
Hoppy aroma, citrus and herb.  Orange body with lasting head. Full taste, citrus herb and evergreen. Long sit on the tongue e-hop finish.
Can. Hoppy aroma and taste, citrus fruit, light resin notes, medium bitter. Medium body, hoppy bitter finish. Good.
Straight out of the bottle. Aroma is of huge malts, big hops, piny, citrusy and caramel. Over medium bitter, medium sweet. Medium bodied with the same amount of carbonation. Awesome.
Orange pour. Thick foam. Sweet wheat flavor paired with lemongrass. Lemongrass palate. Nicely balanced beer.
Clear copper with an off-white head. Aroma is citrus, pine resin with a grainy backbone. Taste is light/medium sweet and heavy bitter.

A 22 oz can I got for my birthday. You remember when I cook Melba to go get our teeth. Thick white head on top of a hazy dark golden body. The aroma is complex it's hard to narrow it down smells like a little bit of everything. It's good but not exceptional it doesn't kill my Peloton aftertaste like the average ipas and give a few bonus points but there's nothing to write home about either. But I like it because it's not a typical IPA so your IPA lover probably won't like it as much as I do

APARÊNCIA
âmbar, levemente turva.
creme branco de boa formação e bastante persistente.
AROMA
floral, pêssego, pinho, tangerina e toranja.
SABOR
base maltada, caramelo, seguido por um perfil bem cítrico com amargo moderado.
SENSAÇÃO
corpo médio e carbonatação moderada.

12 oz. can. Golden orange pour with hefty white foam head, solid retention. Moderate carbonation. Luscious aroma of citrus, grapefruit, resin and pine. Massive palate on this beer deeply quenched my thirst with thick layers of expertly balanced caramel malt and fantastic, juicy, fruity hops. Bitterness is also well balanced with fruity aromatic notes and malt sweetness.

I applaud the full flavor and perfect balance of this beer. This is more than just another dime-a-dozen, run-of-the-mill IPA (of which there are hundreds). This is a fully fleshed out creation worthy of building a brand name around. Two Hearted Ale also manages to hit a sweet spot in between IPA and Imperial IPA, but more closely aligns with the former. Compares very favorably to DFH60 Minute and Founder's Harvest Ale.

I plan to add a rating for the draft variant upon next tasting.
I think this beer is horrible.  I think if I added used engine oil to it, it would taste better.  I'm not trying to mean.  It's just that it truly tastes that bad to me.
Amber with a white head and a caramel, whiskey nose. Well-carbonated with a malty mouthfeel and a caramel finish. Some warming.

Bell's Brewery Two Hearted Ale: 12oz can. Easy pour into a pint glass with a nice head. Beautiful appearance of hazy golden amber and solid white head. Pleasant aromas of yeast and apricot. Wonderful mouthfeel. Well balanced flavor with clean bitter finish. Really great offering. Impressed.
Creamy head Lacing all the way to the bottom. Medium bodied with grapefruit hoppy flavor. Very clean from start to finish. My go to beer.

How: Can.

Where: Had at home.

Appearance: Dark golden colour with a white head.

Aroma: Malt, hops, grapefruit, fruit.

Body: Medium body and carbonation.

Flavour: Malt, fruit, grapefruit, citrus, hops, oranges.

Draft.  Bright, hoppy aroma and flavor, with a prominent malt base.  Malt:Hop ratio 60:40.  Pours a translucent yellow color.  Citrusy hops, esp. grapefruit.  Slightly sweet, with an appropriately medium bitter finish.  Very smooth and very drinkable, start to finish.  Not overly hoppy or punchy, so it may not win awards at tastings, but a smooth and drinkable IPA with a malty prominence.  Perfect go-to American IPA.
Fruity, malty, hoppy and a bit bitter with tastes of grapefruit, pineapple, and lemon. Reminds me of traditional IPAs.
Drinking in Boston with roasted ducks. Nice beer but a desperate night. Seahawk lost by inches to the touchdown line. Heartbreaking.
Ipa molto buona, dorata con schiuma media, ha una buona base maltata e resinosa, con sentori di agrumi e puntina fruttata. Amaro medio. Carbonazione bassa.

Bottle in Nachbar Bar, Louisville. Clear golden amber with a medium white foam head. Nose is citrus, orange marmalade, biscuit, orange peel, pine. Taste is is orange and grapefruit peel, pine, biscuit, caramel. More of an old school IPA. Really nice.

12 fl oz can. Appearance is a dull, hazy copper gold, with a thick one and a half fingers of soapy white froth. Aromas are a range from citrus and grapefruit, to pine and wood. Taste starts with a bittersweet grapefruit note, some bready malts and dough, piney and resin bitter, and a little toffee or caramel. Quite a range of flavours packed into a small can!
0,473 litre Can from 7-11 Carlsbad, Ca. Golden with white head. Malts, hops, piney, grains.

Poured from 12 oz bottle into pint glass. A 1" pillowy off white head drops slowly with moderate lacing. Color is hazy orange. Aroma pine, citrus, white bread dough. Mouthfeel is medium and slightly astringent with a quite dry finish. Flavor is well balanced between the pine/citrus hops and the sweet malts with a hint of honey. Overall: a classic in the style.
This beer, with all due respect, destroys all others. In the words of Tina Turner "you're simply the best, better than all the rest".

Aroma is some caramel some raisin some nice fruity grapes pineapple and other tropic fruit. Taste is sweet caramel slightly oxidized. Juicy drinkable and fruity. Long malty finish with the fruuty hop flavours above. Nice.

Bottle Packaged on 06/27/19
Coppery amber orange with slight haze
Rich thick head with good lacing dissipates slowly
Nose: Cream Caramel orange-vanilla, coriander and nutmeg with a hint of passion fruit and grape. 
First Sip: Sweet Malt bread caramel and cream opening to ripe stone fruit passion fruit
Develops into dank loam pine and orange peel.
Mouthfeel soft inviting vibrant and smooth.
Finish Big long Hoppy finish characterized by pine grapefruit and resin, very smooth no astrigency .
Overall a glorious IPA to drink and savor.

Bottle from Varsity.  Amber gold with fine head.  Grapefruit and toast aroma.  Med carb.  Really nice IPA without overpowering hops letting some fruity complexity through with a nuttier smooth finish.
Poured from 12oz bottle. Amber color with nice, thick, white head. Smooth, got, and well-balanced. Superb APA!
Thick foamy head color looks light orange copper smell of tropical fruits hops caramel taste of fruits bitter finish smooth drinking
Great piney and grapefruity hop profile with distinct malt backbone. Solid west coast style IPA.

Deep apricot color with a thinning cottony head. Aromas of light pine and a touch of loam. Delicious on the palette with apricot and lighter hop bite. Almost malty. GREAT!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Fantastic mild smooth floral beginning. slightly sweetish, refreshing with pine and resin. Moderate bitterness, round and mild in the aftertaste.

Can @ Friends/Dr Yeast. Appearance: pours slightly hazy golden with good white soapy head and lacing. aroma/taste: barley, bread, light caramel, pine, orange and light tropical fruity notes. palette: strong us hoppy aroma, average carbonation, medium body, medium to notable sweetness, balanced by a medium to notable bitterness, average duration and a watery texture. Overall: Smooth piny IPA
Earthy indeed. Nice bready base. Great fruity hoppy punch. Pine, grapefruit, passion and such. Full body.

Najlepsza IPA i AIPA jaką piłem. Aromat świetny - słodki zapach - mango, ananas, papaja, melon. Piana obfita, nietrwała. Barwa pomarańczowo-żółta. Lekko zmętnione, nieprzejrzyste. Jak na 55IBU to goryczka odczuwalna dużo niższa. Przyjemny, fajny chmiel. Mimo iż posiada 7% alk. obj. to nie jest od wyczuwalny w piwie. W smaku czuć Amerykańskie chmiele, lekką słodycz, słodowość. Delikatny finish z lekką goryczką.
[10, 4, 7, 5, 17] [032819]
Hoppy IPA, with a delicate finish. Like someone who steals your bike, but leaves an apologetic note.
Gold with a frothy white head. Aroma of peach cobbler and papaya.  Bittersweet taste, sweeter at the end but finishes with a medium, lingering bitterness. Fruity and nuanced. Good.
One of the best American IPA’s out there. Poors hazy, but lightens up to produce a piny finish. Gets better each sip.

This beer is well deserving of the accolades it gets.  Pours a hazy medium orange with aromas of sweet fruits and malts.  Smallish light tan head that dissipates slowly.  Full mouth feel.  Sticky.  Mildly bitter aftertaste is joined with an even milder sweetness.  A good balance of hops and malts makes this beer a refreshing and impressive taste experience.  As a lover of big barrel age RI stouts this American IPA impresses with a similar big feel, perfect for summertime sips from a snifter.  Will have again!

Pours light amber, a little oily, somewhat hazy too maybe, well developped, light mocha head, good lacing.  Aroma: nice malty base, bitter, oranges, lychee, some grapefruit indeed.  Taste: good bitterness, fine grapefruit finish, distinctly grainy, spicy, resinous, a tad soapy mayb, soft caramelly malts underneath.  Very good, great bitterness, sweetness limited to the lychee and orange fruits underneath the bitter hops.

Pours up a slightly hazy gold color in the glass, with a off white head that lasted, and left some lace. Aroma has some pine, grapefruit, and malty notes. Taste is some bitter dry hops up front, then a mild fruit like sweetness and malts come in to balance things out. Sticky feel. Not bad.
Aroma is melty, sweet caramel with fruits. Palate is sweet beginning, peach and apricots, biscuit, and piney, lingering finish with bitter aftertaste. Great

Ich hab das hier in einem plädderichen Plastikbecher in einem Motel in New Hampshire und muss sagen, das schaut echt gut aus. In der Nase brotig, im Trunk hopfig, grasig, trocken, leicht Zitrus, angenehm bitter, lecker.
Pours dark golden with moderate foam. Taste full of flavors with wood chips and pine.

Hat ja perfekte Bewertungen und ist ja auch gut, aber mir etwas too much von allem. Für eine Topbewertung fehlt mir die Rafinesse. In einem Shop in Manhattan gekauft.
Sehr starkes fruchtiges Aroma (Tropenfrüchte). Im Geschmack sehr Bitter, Grapefruit, Malz.

Good aroma of tropical and grapefruit. A very good up front taste. Slight citrus taste. A typical slightly strong IPA aftertaste . The more you drink it the better it gets. It doesn't age well at all.

Can from the fabulous shop in Grand Canyon Village - golden color, white head. very round and smooth IPA, low fruityness, more on the resinious, hoppy side. medium bitter. high drinking quality. perfect.
Draught@Cafe Deluxe, Gergetown, D.C. Slightly murky deep golden, small off-white head. Nose hops, grapefruit, honey. Strongly bitter taste with some soft sweet notes.
Hop aromas of pine and grapefruit, lovely beer, truly and enjoyable experience
Bottled at Fire and Hops, Santa Fe, New Mexico, USA. Hazy dark golden colored. Powerful hoppy and fruity aroma. Very bitter, but really nice.

I’ve had this beer so many times, I’m not sure how I’m just now eating it. It’s been my go-to IPA for a decade. It has the best of everything you want in a beer and IPA. This is the standard by which I judge all other IPAs.
Amazing. Cream de la cream. The perfect fishing beer. Two hearted is so sophisticated like a wise and goofy grandfather teaching his grandson to fish.  Once again amazing.
Well balanced and sessionable. Always gets over descibed. The safest bet when the bar you’re at doesn’t have many craft options.
This IPA is one of the best IPAs of it's kind: average IPA. It is balanced and goes down easy but it doesn't do any overly interesting. Not a bad beer either way.
Amber color. Piney on the nose. Nice evergreen and grapefruit on the palate. Well balanced! Pretty solid.

This beer lives up to the accolades. Incredibly well-balanced. Aroma of grapefruit and slight sweetness from the malts. Taste is more grapefruit and overripe tangerines. Minimal bitterness to finish. Easy to see why this is such a legendary beer. My go to IPA.

16 oz can. Smells piney. Amber colored with an orange tint, clear. Nice blend of sweet and bitter, tastes of grapefruit, malt and pine. Tastes of malts, followed by resinous hops. Slightly bitter but clean finish.
First American IPA I had 25 years ago. The benchmark by which all American IPAs are measured. I guess, that's all that needs to be said.

Strong grapefruit flavor with citrus and pine lingering in the background. Very nice smooth tasting beer. Bitter finish. Very well put together. Make sure it is very cold than the crisp flavors come out. Well done!
On tap at One Mile House. Pours orange gold. Pine, grapefruit, pineapple, touch of papaya, orange peel, nice lingering bitterness. Good body. Very nice.

11/4/18 (Chicago): Canned 9/25/18, purchased at Bell's General Store earlier in the day, 6 pack cans $11.50 w/ tax. Can poured into pint glass. Slighty dark golden color, puffy head, thick lacing, solid carbonation. Citrus pine aroma, sharp pleasant, sweet. Very well balanced, citrus pine taste, dry hops, bitter nice. Dry creamy mouth feel, solid presence, smooth drinking. Overall excellent IPA, glad I stopped at Bell's Brewery for this one!

Poured cloudy golden yellow, very heavy grapefruit aroma. Very smooth, little to no bite on the backend. I’d describe it as a malty taste which makes it different. Good beer... for an IPA.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draft into tulip. Hard to beat this beer and it’s all it’s hyped up to be. Great aroma of pine. Generous lacing. Very light citrus mouthfeel. Smooth. All IPAs need to live up to this one.

Pours amber with a hint of cloudiness. Thick head, heavy carbonation. Aroma of hops and pine. Taste includes citrus and the typical IPA elements. Palate has oak, citrus and a complex arrangement of hops. Incredibly drinkable, lives up to the hype.

Ice Cold from the fridge. Cloudy orange color with thick head. Pungent pine, citrus and floral aroma from the moment you pop the cap. Taste is grapefruit zest/juice, orange, lemon grass and mango. Clean dry hoppy finish. Damn impressive for a single IPA.
Can share from Beer Cellar.  Great pour. Frothy head and sexy amber cloud. Taste was lacking the punch of bitterness I was expecting.  Overall a good beer.
My single favorite IPA. Drinkable, but not weak. Citrusy, old school IPA.

Pours a medium amber coloration with a medium, creamy head. Not very intense, but nice aromas of biscuity malt, grapefruit, orange peel and a hint of pine in the nose. Taste follows suit, with a very nice balance of biscuity, slightly caramelly malt and lightly resinous citrus hops. Notes of grapefruit, orange peel and pine. Finishes with a medium bitterness and some light pine lingering in the aftertaste. Smooth mouthfeel with a medium body and carbonation. Classic old school IPA with a certain West Coast accent to it. Quite nice for what it is and really well-balanced.
Lys brun med høyt hvitt skum. Lukter søte frukter. Middels fylde. Lett bitter sitrus, karamell og ananas. (Beavertown Beerextravaganza 2018)
Decent, well-rounded, well-balanced IPA from Bell’s. Totally solid. Thoroughly enjoyed. 100ml glass at Beaverex’18.
Pint at tavern on main Sarasota. Yeasty but refreshing. Delicious. Also had this at the bar at the top of the holiday inn in mobile....

355ml Flasche. Klar und dunkelgolden mit minimaler Schaumkrone. Citrathopfen im Antrunk, geschmacklich intensiv und fruchtig. Ordentlicher Körper. Runder Abgang. Leckeres und gut ausbalanciertes Bier.

Clear pour with nice fluffy head. Aroma is malty, bready, with good pine and citrus. Taste brings the hops forward, but this is a not super hoppy IPA. Very well balanced, smooth, nice textures. Deserving of its reputation. Never disappoints.
Definitely one of the best IPA’s out there. Has a nice orangey color, and the malt/hop ratio is excellent.  A delicious brew, I am drinking it right now poured from a 16 oz. can.

From a can to a glass. Pours a crystal clear amber color with a monster frothy creamy head. Aroma is sweet caramel bready malts and citrusy,  slight lemon, mango, orange,  pineapple, guava,earthy herbal piney hops balancing it all out. Taste follows the aroma well with a medium mouthfeel. Thick malt rings all down the glass. Very good Ipa! $11 otd  a six pack is a great deal!
Very smooth and bizarre tastefully made ipa, it’s the traditional one but with an extra finishing touch, drinkable as hell!

Grapefruit, malt, and more citrus fruits on the nose. Very big head, lots of carbonation. Dark golden in color. Almost brown. Taste has some nuttiness, like a brown ale, followed by pine, hops, grapefruit and sweet malt. Not what I was expecting but good stuff.
Found in bottle from hotel in Champaign, Illinois. Good malt forward IPA. I didn't get a lot of hop flavor but was enjoyable. Good early fall beer.

Fruity  and pine aroma . The body is a hazy golden amber with a frothy head to start. Bold bitterness is balanced well with a sweet fruit grain. It had medium bodied mouthfeel but is super friendly on the palate. Can’t wait to have another.

My favorite straight up IPA. Pours with an 1.5" head that sticks around and laces nicely down the glass. Great hops aroma and taste with just enough but not overbearing bite. There is a nice malt in the background which smooths the hoppy bite out just a little and makes it very easy to drink. This is a no brainer to take to a party, give someone to try, or just enjoy yourself when it's time to relax after a long week.
My reference point for what fresh floral juicy fruit ipa’s should be - and rarely do I find one measure up

Golden, ever so slightly hazy. Aroma is floral some citrus. Taste grass, pine, some grapefruit, bitter enough. Medium body. Not an extreme or exciting beer but one you could easily drink two or three of, on a warm evening.
Very very good. A little sweetness that kind of coats the hops but it has a unique taste that is so addictive
This my go to IPA!!!  Whether on the river or an evening drink on the deck.  Amber coloring and hoppy taste and aroma are consistent and strong!!

Hazy amber, lasting head. 
Medium body, intense flavor, smooth texture, rich mouthfeel, nice heat and carbonation, great length, tasty finish. 
Bitter, dry, crisp. 
Hoppy, assertive and beautiful flavor, malty, herbal, grapefruit, caramel. 
Delicious, great balance body/flavor. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft 0.25l at BeerTemple, Amsterdam, The Netherlands. 08.06.2018. Pour it slighty hazy orange color with small white head. Aroma orange candy, not so fresh unfortunately, some pine notes. Taste tangerine, some orange candy, grapefruit, not fresh, quite old actually, but you can see potential, hope I will try this one day fresh.

The best regular IPA out there. You won’t break the bank buying this either. Great Hops taste with no bitter aftertaste. Bells doesn’t mess around with 2 Hearted. Distinct Palate flavor of citrus/pine mix and extremely drinkable anywhere. So glad I live in Michigan. There’s not many IPAs that come close this unless they are a double. Full flavor on every sip
Pour from a bottle is hazy thick orange with a thin head. Dry hoppy bread taste. Light mouthfeel with a grassy finish.
Nice hop aroma and biscuity malt sweetness. Mostly pithy and sweet floral peppery hop flavors. Still so so good.

From tap at BeerTemple, Amsterdam. Aroma is citrussy hops with orange, tropical fruits, grapefruit, biscuity malt, and some pine. Flavour is sweetish with an above medium bitterness. Body is medium. Classic, a bit sweeter than I expected but it holds up nicely.
Pint from tap at Hopsmith Tavern (Chicago). Very floral and piney, finish of grapefruit peel. Amberish yellow. Well-rounded IPA- a must!

Bottled at Bills bar and burger
Hazy golden. White head. 
Fruity, resinous, perfumeish in both aroma and flavour. 
Medium bitterness.
Can 16 fl oz. Foamy white head. Orange color, a bit hazy. Aroma is pineapple, grapefruit peel, rose leaves and american hops. Taste is bitter
Pours an amber from a bottle. Perfectly fine light pine and fruit syrup aroma and flavor. Good beer.

I enjoyed this one a lot. Only grabbed a single to try, but will be getting a 6'er in the near future. Fruity aroma, lots of grapefruit and hops going on. Hazy light orange/golden yellow appearance. Smooth mouthfeel for an IPA. Flavor also is grapefruity with pine and lots of hops. I would say this is a hop bomb. Reminds me of a hoppier version of Lagunita's 2009 Correction Ale. This is the 2nd brew from Bell's that I tried (first one being the Java Stout) and I liked this a lot better. I am officially "hopping" on the Bell's bandwagon.

Fluffy white foamy head that stays fluffy, but cannot discern aromas other than malty or cereal. Same thing with the taste, this is a very drinkable beer, but not hoppy like I expected. Alcohol content is not apparent. I cannot explain why I like this beer, no one thing stands out, maybe it's because it's very well balanced.

Can from Whole Foods. Medium amber/golden with nice fluffy head. Looks great. Aroma is malty, bready, a hint of hops. Taste brings the hops forward, but this is a not big hoppy IPA, so they support the malt bill, working with it. very well rounded, smooth, nice textures. Worthy of its reputation. Been seeking this for a while.

like drinking a grapefruit peel i cant tell you how much i hate thos beer ugh please kill me now

Keg in Clubhouse, Philly. Clear, golden with a thin white head. Pine, tropical fruit aroma, flavour is both of those ramped up to 11, but beautifully balanced. I want to drink this all night, but at 7% I can't. Damn you Bell's!
Always good, always constant!  When someone new to craft beer wants to know what an "IPA" tastes like this is what I give them. A perfect example of a can't go wrong IPA.

Phenomenal beer. One of the best tasting IPA's I've ever tasted. Would definitely buy a case and recommend it to everyone.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

1/22/18
With Abby and James and they got back from Lana Del Ray concert. 

Poured from can bought back in Chatt. Hazy medium amber with a head that dissipates pretty quick. 

Smell is classic IPA. Piney/floral hops. 

Taste is juicy hops. Very floral and I’m really tasting the pine. Not super fruity. Significant caramel malt but it’s not that sweet. Supremely well-balanced. Delicious. 

Palate is sticky medium-thick. Bitter hops hang around on the finish. 

Overall, I had high expectations and this really lived up to it. Pretty much a perfect, balanced IPA that’s bitter and aromatic but also malty.


8/27/1
With A hanging out in workout room. Wanted to try again as I’ve had a lot of awesome IPA’s since I last had this one and am curious to see how it stands up. 

Poured from a 16oz van into a Coca-Cola glass. Effervescent orange with a nice sticky head. Bubbles continually coming up from the bottom of the glass. 

Nose is quite floral with some citrus and pine behind. 

Taste is very flowery and bright but has a nice malt balance. Floral notes far outshine and citrus/pine notes but the herbal/piney flavors come in on the end. Moderately bitter with a nice dose of caramel malt sweetness on the tongue. 

Medium palate that finishes with more flowery hops. Nice and long bitter finish. 

Overall, trying this agin was as good as I remembered. No wonder it’s consistently so acclaimed!

On draft at bar Louie CWE. Oh how I reminisce on college days.... 
Aroma  6 /10: very faint hoppy, grassy, a tad floral aroma. Can't detect much, but it's pleasant. 
Appearance 4 /5: a classically attractive beer. Clear amber with big frothy white head. 
Palate 4 /5: incredibly smooth with little resinous aftertaste lingering. Weirdly smooth to me, for an IPA. 
Taste 7 /10: heavy on the malt, I taste a  lot of rye and roasted malt. In terms of hops it's minimal, some wood and oakiness is detectable. 
Overall  16 /20: I know that people love this beer, and I don't blame them. This is a classic beer for people who like beers. For me, it doesn't fall into the ipa category. It tastes like a very smooth ale. For that reason, my overall us considerably lower than others. 
Final: 3.7

On tap at Bar Louie in STL. 
Aroma 8/10: Clean notes of grass and pine. 
Appearance 5/5: Thick white head that is very sticky and resinous. Lovely lacing on my 20 ounce pour. 
Palate 5/5:  Substantial and carbonated. Sticky but not overly sweet. 
Taste 10/10: A very good, easy to drink ale. Some resin flavors with that classic ipa pine. 
Overall 19/20: One of my favorite beers. A classic American ale. 

4.7

New York Jan 2018
Amber, clear. Small but Persistent head.
Amazing beer considering it claims to be single hop - centennial. Smell of resin with some freshness. Aroma of resin but lots of grapefruit. Very refreshing while butter, and not too sugary. I can se myself droning it in the forest after a good day of exploration/ kayak, waiting for the food to cook on the fire... good one.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Caramel colored with decent lacy head. About as close to ideal balance of malt backbone and hops as it gets. You probably will not find a better beer than this—Astonishing complexity for a single hopped beer. Has just enough specialty malts to give the malt bill a bit of caramely complexity. Simultaneously has ample piney and grapefruit notes with a bit of stone fruit, floral, and resiny character.

Many breweries seem to do a decent job with IPA’s, but this is still my favorite:
*The name calls to mind one of my favorite short stories, “Big Two-hearted River”
*Just looking at the trout on the label unwinds the spring in my mind a couple clicks
*It comes from Kalamazoo, where we lived 3 years and where my son was born, so experiencing it is sort of like old trout John returning to his native stream.
*I like the 16-oz. can, which is just right for throwing into or digging out of a cooler.
*When I get philosophical, I can lament the fact Bell’s still hasn’t figured out that “two-hearted” is a compound adjective, and needs a hyphen.
*It tastes great, especially with things like grilled shrimp, carrot cake, or both.

Can. Shaker. Orange, medium hazy with medium, off-white, frothy head. Good head retention and lacing. Aroma is moderately to heavy malty (pale malts, but also some flat caramel character), moderately hoppy - mainly grape, orange and grapefruit grape, also slightly soapy and flowery. Taste is moderately sweet and moderately bitter, stable with long duration with some kick in the aftertaste. Medium body, oily texture. soft to average carbonation, finish is bitter, soapy and classical. Summary: IPA mainly based on grapes and oranges aroma with not really friendly malty character - slightly soapy. Beside this everything is on the right place - the bitterness, balance and timing. PODSUMOWANIE (Polish): IPA w głównej mierze bazująca na aromatach winogron, pomarańczy i grejfrutów, czyli reprezentująca trochę odmienny charakter w porównanie do tego co mamy do zaoferowanie na polskiej scenie kraftowej (głównie owoce tropikalne, aroamty kwiatowe). Na plus jest na pewno jej bardzo zbalansowany charakter z wyróżniającą się goryczką. Niestety aroamty winogorogonowo-pomarańczowe spowodowały, że nabrała trochę mdłego charakteru. Finalna ocena jest trochę subiektywna (czytaj. zaniżona), co do stylu na pewno koło 4.0, co do mojego personalnego odbioru to ocena jest taka jak widać.
