The body is copper and troubled, thin and white foam, middle/high carbonation. The taste is well balanced, a really good mix between the malt, the hop and the sweetness, toffee, the taste is becoming always better after to drink a part of the bottle, grassy, a little soapy due to the hop, nice sensation in the mouth.

BOTTLE 12 OZ. Hazy amber, creamy ivory head. Very rounded fruity and malty aroma. A bit perfumey, almost rose water or Turkish delight. Lightest piney notes. Taste: again, kinda Turkish delight kind of sweetness, no proper malts, grapefruit peel, crisp yet smooth zesty bitterness. Very nice, even if 4 months old.
Bottle to glass, dark straw color, average off white head with some lacing. Heavy floral citrus and average bread nose. Medium thin body and thin texture.Sweet bitter taste that lingered.

Dark orange colour, white head. Aroma of flowers, citrus, grapefruit. Taste is light bitter, slightly sweet. A bit flat on the flavours, I guess its an old bottle. Light body, slick texture, average carbonation. I expected a lot more.

Aroma floral y resinoso
Buen aspecto con carbónatacion correcta y espuma persistente
En boca balanceada fruta madura caramelo final seco y floral

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
From a can. Lots of head. Citrus, floral. Crisp. Tasty beer. Clear. Good carb

This is a great IPA, not overwhelming but strong enough to pack a punch fun beer!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Clear amber golden colour, white head. Hoppy aroma, floral quite fruity, pine, lemon, summer field. Bitter flavour, hops, apricot, tropical fruits. Bitter finish, hops, floral hops, summer meadow. Nice!
(from 35cL can @ my Cologne hideout)

Pours hazy golden to alightly amber with minimum, quickly diminishing off white top. Aroma is very full, yeast and full malty notes, some honey notes hidden in there as well. Very strong carbonation upfront, which quickly gives way to a slight bitter body, not to full, then a nice sweet taste evolving in to a bitter finish takes over. Nice!

Kicsi, nem túl tartós hab, borostyán szín, szűretlen. Enyhe, édeskés, gyümölcsös illat. Déligyümölcsös, fűszeres, enyhén gyantás ízvilág, hajszálnyi karamellel és gyantával, hosszú lecsengéssel. Testes, közepesen szénsavas, enyhén keserű. Nagyon finom, ízletes, jól kiegyensúlyozott, intenzív ízvilágú sör.

Nice cloudy blonde colour and lasting head. Not too carbonated. Massive floral aroma. Some fruit as well. Medium bitterness and light sweetness. Oily texture. Fresh and bitter aftertaste. This is my kind of beer.
Can. Hoppy. Aroma of citrus and pine with floral notes. Malty backbone. The flavours starts light sweet but finish with crisp bitterness. The body is medium and the texture is juicy. A nice one
0,33l bottle. Nose: some spicyness I can’t really put a name on, hoppy resiny aromas. Taste: smooth, very balanced sweetness and pleasant floral hoppiness. Superbly balanced ipa and very refreshing!

12oz bottle. Hazy amber color with a fluffy white head. Hops and tangerine aroma. Bitter citrus resin up front with a nice malt/hop balance finish. Medium body.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Little head with heavy lacing. Citrus piney aroma. Light caramel color. Heavily carbonated but sits nicely on the tongue. Smooth finish. Hoppy crisp taste. Very good IPA that can be found easily in Michigan. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Well developed full beer with cunning tastes and quality. Flavor doesn’t sit around in your mouth which is nice. I would get again

(backlog) Sampled bottled, near source tripping the UP 2013 and at resampled at Braukunst Live 2015, ta jfb. - Bref: near modernist focus and zeal at work here, squeezing all the hard-worn sprucey, pithy dank goodness out of Centennial hops into the essence of a quenching IPA, tonic like mountain rainwater. Nothing over the top or childishly in your face here - stern and silvery UP liquid at its finest. Hope to revisit fresh again.
Pours and amber body with a thin head. Faint hopp aroma. Refreshing hoppy taste with a nice and subtle bitterness. Very nice for an IPA.

I'm not an IPA drinker at all and I usually don't like the bitterness but this beer I absolutely love. The flavor and the head is phenomenal. I would definitely buy this beer again and this is in my top 10 of best beers I ever had in my life. I recommend this to everyone who wants to try an amazing good tasting beer 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours dark golden, almost copper color. Great nose, sticky hop flavor, good balance
Best aroma of citrus, resin and malt sweetness in background. Copper color with small head. Middle hops bitterness, citrus, a bit malty. Middle body with small carbonation.

Bottle. Pours is clear golden with thick white head. Aroma is heavy floral with touch of resin and spruce. Taste is moderate bitter, resiny mouthfeel. Medium body, nice creamy texture, soft carbonation, long, crispy bitter finish. Incredibly well ballanced.

Enjoyed this reputable IPA with a fine view and a cool summer breeze. From the bottle, poured a hazy yellow-orange color, seems to be exceptionally hazy for an IPA, with lots of lacing and foam, which thins to slight white head. Aroma is a delicious variety of malty grain and floral citrus hops, the sweet malt and juicy hops combine to form notes of sweet orange. Flavor is a full-bodied malty smoothness with a solid pacific resin and citrus hoppy bitterness, quite the sensory combination. Finishes with a warm caramel malty accented bitterness, definitely memorable if not quite as stellar as its high reviews suggest. Definitely delicious overall. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Lots of points for balance, but (I can’t believe I am saying this) nothing striking me as special here. The nose features juicy citrus hops, a touch of dankness and mild malts. Undertated though. The taste profile follows from the nose with mild fruity hops, classic soft malts, a smooth body and a nice dry finish.
A flawless, thoroughly balanced IPA with a unique flavour profile. Aromas of cherimoya and roses, taste of cherimoya, other tropical fruits and roses. Dry finish.

Can: Served in a shaker:
Creamy head. Cloudy yellow.
Aromas of creamy hop fruits, some floral tones, clear hop tones...
Taste more like a DIPA than an IPA.
Good bitter, some hop tones, herbal and floral, light dry, bit creamy...
Aftertaste is grassy, hoppy, bitter, dry...
Low carbo, creamy mouthfeel, medium bodied.
Expected more but surely decent.

Pours a hazy yellow with minimal head. Smells of resin, pine, apricot and a biscuity malt. Taste is grapefruit, pine, biscuit, and caramel. Medium bodied, moderately carbonated, and a bitter finish. Very nice, well balanced, extremely drinkable.

Merci à Simon pour celle çi! Un nez qui se rapproche des IPAs anglaises. Mais, en portant un peu plus attention, on se rend compte que le côté fruité typiquement américain se pointe le nez. Le résultat est une IPA assez balancée. Peut-être un peu trop sucrée par contre (ici encore "à la mode" des IPA anglaises), mais toutefois fort goûteuse. La lourdeur de l’alcool se fait légèrement sentir mais est au bout du compte bien contenue. Est-ce les houblons utilisés (on semble parler de Centennial dans les critiques précédantes) qui ne sont pas ma tasse de thé? Je ne saurais dire, mais il manque un petit quelque chose pour venir gagner mon coeur. C’est un peu trop lourd, trop sucré.

Bottle. Pale clear orange body, medium head. Citric/resiny aroma with floral hints. Smooth taste of citrus and piney Centennial hops. Good balance, very refreshing. I love IPAs that are made with Centennial hops and this one’s a very good showcase of this hop.

On tap at tipsy barrel. Nice malt hop aroma. Cloudy orange gold with lacing tan head. Piney, citrus and floral hops dominate with a good sweet slightly toasted malt back. Spice notes. Full flavored with great balance. Outstanding.

It has extremely beautiful white and creamy foam and aroma of pine needles and grapefruit. The taste has a little malt sweetness in the form of caramel and sweetness keeps reasonable before the hops sneak into the mouth and contributes with pine needles, grapefruit, mango and orange peel. The finish is dry and lasts long.
Bottle @ The Bishops Arms Marina, Helsingborg 20160815. Hoppy and fruity, sweet, grapefruits, pine needles, oranges, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is dry, bitter and fruity.

Burk från Mikkeller webshop. Smak och doft av humle, malt, karamell, persika, mango, citrus, grapefrukt, gräs och blommor. Torr, lagom sötma, rund och krispig, fruktig och frisk, aningen trött humle men ölen är välbalanserad med en fin citrusskalsbeska som avslut. Gott!

Bottled 01/26/2016. It’s cloudy orange with a medium big, lasting head. Aroma has a sweet side to it with notes of sponge cake, candied mango, cotton candy, lots of other fruits like passion fruit, pears, lots of pineapple, fresh and from a can. When shaken it develops more malty notes of cake, cake bottom plus some more spicy ginger and resin. Nice. Mouth feel is silky soft, medium thick with delicate carbonation. Good mouth feel for this style. Good balance with juicy malt start and long bitterness that evolves into stronger resin like type. I got also impression of warming alcohol in the end. Also a bit hot like candied ginger. Overall a good IPA.

Canned Dated was 6/29/16: The beer poured very clear but not crystal clear which is to be expected for a beer with as much kettle and dry hop as this beer has. Beautiful, creamy white head formed immediately and lasted. The color is straw to light copper. The aroma is more balanced than one would expect for an IPA hopped with Pacific NW Centennial. Aroma is more malty but the citrus of the Centennial does come through. The first taste is more to the malt bill but the Centennial shines on the back side. Bitterness is well balanced with the malt bill and lingers on the back and sides of the tongue. If their house yeast is the yeast it’s purported to be, they do a great job with it. The beer is much fruitier than other IPAs and is more malty sweet than most but it fits in well with the mid-west style IPA. This is a great beer that I could drink WAY too many off!

Bottle 0,33l from Stella Beer beer shop in Medulin, Cro. Dark golden hazy, average head. Smell of overripe fruits with a hint of herbs. Medium body and carbonation. Taste of sweet fruits, has some bitterness, citrus peal, wormwood. Long finish. This bottle isn’t very fresh, I think.

Hazy golden color, average sized white head that left lots of lacing. Aroma of malt, peach, tangerine, persimmon. Taste of malt, peach, tangerine, tropical fruits. Clearly not the freshest bottle but still better than most IPAs I had recently. I simply must try this fresh.

-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Pours a hazy golden yellow with a thick fluffy off white head. The aroma is very floral and grapefruit. The aroma is just amazing. The flavor is once again full of grapefruit and some breadiness. There is a little bit of pine as well. There is some hop kick but rather mild. One of the best ipas I have ever had.
Bottle.Bronze with a small head. Hoppy with floral flavours in background. Slightly bitter finish. An all round decent beer.

Bottle at Põrgu in Tallinn. Bottled March 2016 (i.e. couple months ago). Pours hazy darkish amber with modest off-white head. Excellent malty caramelly sweet aroma with strong ripe fruitiness. Peach. Grapefruit. Pine. Almost a minty freshness. Tastes fruity bittersweet with an almost aggressive bitter kick yet overall it’s well balanced by the malts. Citric and resiny. Grassy even. Carbonation somewhat prickly, body medium, oily slick resiny palate. Really nice.



Edit: Bottle from random deli in Brooklyn. Bottled 4 months ago. Would now rate it around 3.5 or so, it's really nothing special nor especially rewarding, just a rather nice, more resinous bitter than tropical fruity IPA. Goes down easy. Would buy again if nothing more interesting in sight. Not gonna change my initial score though.
Can. Creamy white good mostly lasting head. Moderate malty and hoppy aroma. Moderate bitter flavor. Average moderate bitter finish. creamy palate.
Can. Nice creamy head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are rich hops, flowers, fruits, malt and has a nice fruity finish.

A little of both piney and floral hops in the nose with some fruit notes and mild malt. Cloudy dark golden, almost orange with quick white foam. Medium body and light fizz. The resiny hops dominate, but the citrus and malt provide good supporting notes. Slightly dry finish. A favorite IPA.

Bottle.

A- Subtle orange, subtle pine.

A- Amber orange color, hazy liquid, white head.

T- Mild sweetness, tangerine, subtle bitterness, slightly malty.

P- Medium body, average texture, average carbonation, balanced finish.

O- Wow this is tasty, especially considering I’m not much of an IPA guy. This is definitely a beer to introduce someone to the IPA family. Not too bitter, not too malty, just a nice balance with a touch of citrus sweetness. Very easy to drink.

Bit hazy golden, white frothy head, ok lacing. Ok looks. Sweet and quite malty, dark bread, toasted notes, bit caramel, citric hops and pine, bit nutty. Smooth and round, sweet and roasted slightly, medium body, long bitter finish dries some to wood and grapefruit and pine. Some bit harsh notes disturbing bit. Ok, tasty but some off-notes.
One of my favorites. Charachters of both an Ale and IPA. Powerful flavor but not overwhelming. First experience was out of a mini keg on my birthday camping so very positive memories!

Cloudy orange golden color with a fine white head. Nice lacing. Looks great. Nice intensity in the aroma. Medium + body and a soft carbonation. Semi dry and a nice fresh bitterness. Moderate sweet. Citric, pine, grapefruit hoppy and mellow fruity flavor. Solid stuff.
[Bottle at Pudel in Talllinn, Estonia]
a fantastic, hoppy IPA; light amber color; great citrusy hop aroma; really great citrusy hop flavor with light pine and tropical fruit notes on a medium bodied bready malt base

Bottle shared. Clear golden with of white head. A bit strange on the nose with old mango and some dusty malts. Passion fruit, quite some caramel, mango, orange, ash, soft wood, light flowery. Medium sweet and almost medium bitter. Medium bodied. Past its prime maybe. 

 Tap. Bit fresher and fruitier, quite light bitterness here. Nice.
0,33 bottle from a sixpack i bought at walmart, michigan someplace. - Aroma has grapefruit, mango and watermelom. Slight grainy sweet flavor with some caramel and winegums. Very balanced.

Pours a hazy orange color. About two fingers eggshell colored rocky pillowy head. Excellent retention, excellent lacing.

Aroma is wet cardboard, tangerine and maybe also orange zest. There’s good piney hops in there.

Taste is clean. Very smooth to start, then comes bitter. It’s bready, and also sweet. It’s resiny and citrusy. Malty and sweet.

Mouthfeel is medium full. It’s dry. It’s smooth and somewhat creamy. Well balanced all around.

Overall, it’s great. I would recommend this, and I would certainly buy this again. Not much to say about it. If you see it buy it!
Pours golden with a citrus/orange aroma, tastes of very mild pine and coriander and sweet citrus. Very smooth with evident carbonation.

Bottle pour from Craft Beer Cellar, Clayton. Appearance is hazy dark yellow/light brown, with 1/2 finger-width white head with poor retention, trace lacing. Aroma is floral, tropical fruit, citrus over malt base. Taste is as aroma with a bit more citrus and fruit than aroma. Palate is medium bodied with creamy, foamy texture, average carbonation with balanced sweet floral hoppy/malt. Overall, a solid beer all around with nice flavors to be sure, but not earth shattering.

On tap at local bar. Can’t believe it took me so long to give it a rating since I drink this all the time. Smells semi-sweet with strong floral note and a hint of citrus. Deep gold in color with a thin white head. Mild to strong hop bitterness, mostly floral in flavor but not over powering. Full bodied and a nice long finish. Always amazed at how good, refreshing and well balanced this is.

Aroma: Medium citrus, oranges, , Medium-light malt, bread crusts.
Appearance: Clear, amber, body. Medium, tan head. Fine bubbles, good retention, lacing. 
Flavour: Medium-high bitterness, Medium-high hops, citrus, grapefruit, pith. Medium malt. Dry finish with lingering bitterness, grapefruit, 
Mouthfeel: Medium body. Medium, smooth, carbonation. Light warming.
Overall: Hop forward, bitter. Malt provides a good backbone.

355 ml bottle, poured. Thanks Esme!
21A. American IPA

Lata, Regalo de amigo. 12/07/16 
Color amarillo aromas y sabores frutales final seco.

(Bottle, 0.355 l - pkgd 03/01/16, at Pudel, 20160710) The beer poured amber and hazy. Its head was medium sized and white. Aroma had grass, pine, toffee and malts. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were pine, fruitiness, grass, caramel, malts and bitterness. Aftertaste was sweet, hoppy and bitter. Despite the quite strong sweetness I liked this one.

On tap at Mugs Alehouse, Brooklyn on 8th July 2016. Amber with decaying off-white foam and initial lacing. Zesty hoppiness and peel in aroma. Bitter orange peel, and grapefruit citrus in-mouth. A tangy citric finish. Zingy mouthfeel and a fair amount of body.

OK, I generally do not like IPA’s and wouldn’t have purchased if I had read the label more thoroughly. In this case, I may have found the best IPA for me yet. Doesn’t have the overly hoppy aftertaste of many IPA’s and a really decent taste. I will try it again another day but I think the one is a keeper (That is nod towards the label).
Canned. Hazy golden colour with an off-white head. Aroma and flavour of citrus, hops, fruit, grapefruit, pine and bitterness.

12oz bottle - Pours orange with thick white head. Good smelling brew, aroma of grapefruit and flowers. Big bitter sip... citrus, and hint of roasted malt, but over-powered by the hops. I’m fine with this brew. It’s good; decent... but clearly overrated and now forever apart of folklore.

355ml bottle. Semi-hazy golden with quickly fading two finger white head. Aroma is heavy grapefruit, citrus and caramel. Taste is the same with pronnounced grapefruit bitterness, fruitier citrus and sweet malty caramel in the background. Medium mouthfeel, medium carbonation and lasting bitter aftertaste with warming alcohol.

Can. Aroma of grass, pine, over mango, grapefruit, passion fruit on the tongue. Well carbonated, but not fizzy or lively, rather smooth. Thick and full, yet not overpowered. Very good balance despite all the intensity. Clearly a good brew.
Bärnstensfärgad klar med vit skum. Doftar och smakar massor med tropisk frukt. Annanas och grapefrukt. Lagom beska och lättdrucken
Excellent. Really my kind of IPA. Plenty of piney hop but balanced with a real sweet malt. Not quite as good as the about IPA but I did just drink a 4 pack so I definitely like it.
Sample from bottle at Hy-Vee grocery store. Poured hazy golden, off white head. Aroma was pine, citrus. Taste was mild bitter.
Deep yellow and slightly orange color with nice white head. Sweet fruity aroma. Taste is light fruity and hoppy. Nice balanced IPA, very good to drink!
Pours hazy orange-amber, with little head. Smell is fresh hopiness, some overripe fruitiness underneath. Taste is bitter hops up front, smooths out some after. Thin body, but it fits here. Not bad.

Hazy peachy body, small white head. Aroma of peach, fruit and little bit of booze. Medium to heavy bitter with a little bit of sweetness. Dead hops. Medium body, soft carbonation. //bottle at Craft Room

355ml can served in a pint glass.
A: Pours a slightly cloudy orange color forming a medium creamy soapy white head with good retention and lots of lingering soapy lacings left in the glass. 
S: Nose is incredible. Very flowery, fruity and malty. Strong notes of caramel malts, tangerine, grapefruit, pineapple, resin, pine and hop flowers. 
T: Slightly sweet upfront taste that becomes quickly oily, lingering and bitter. Strong notes of caramel malts, tangerine, grapefruit, pineapple, resin and pine. Strong and very persistent bitter finish. 
M: Medium body. Average carbonation. Tangerine and resin in the aftertaste. Persistent bitterness. 
O: Excellent drinkability. Perfect IPA.

Lata 33 cl tomada en el momento en el Lupulo 10..06..2016. Lote 15455PKGD hasta 29..12..2016 Color ámbar tostado turbio con espuma blanca. Aromas y sabores frescos algo secos y tonos afrutados con toques herbaceos. Bastante buena. Cuerpo medio algo pastoso.

500ml can @El Lúpulo Feroz Oviedo. 06-06-2016.

In short: nice American IPA.

Pours hazy golen with nice white head. Moderate head retention, poor lacing. Pine, resins, fruity nose. Medium body, averge to high carbonation,crispy texture. Taste is quite bitter, pine, earthy, dry aftertaste. Good.

Pours a deep yellow, slightly orange color with a good head. Earthy, piney aroma. Has a strong citrusy hop bite with a good malt backbone. Mouthfeel is a little oily, which coats the tongue with a lingering bitterness. A classic IPA and a good standby, but not completely worth the price and hype. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Four pack of tallboy cans from Gomer’s in KCMO. Pours out a murky light golden amber. Frothy off white head. Floral-musty aromas. Flavor is light and smooth with layers of grapefruit, pine and floral notes. Some spice. Long bitter finish. Very good, but not stellar IMO.

Pint can via Beer Gonzo. It pours a mostly clean orange color with a medium white head. Aroma is tangy and sweet fruity, with notes of apricots and tangerine, light grass and lemon leaves. Taste is also lightly sweet fruity and medium crispy, tangy with notes of orange peel, grass, pine cones and apricots. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, tasty and drinks smoothly

Big thanks to Richthevillan for the big want, cheers Rich. Slightly hazy golden beer with medium head. Aroma is tropical fruit and slightly dusty hops. Taste is lightly stewed fruit, fruit salad, citrus and some grapefruit. Very nice taste, aroma is little muted though. Very good.

US pint can, a bit past it’s prime, probably. Cotteridge, Brum. Hazy, dark gold. Bubbly, thick, glossy topped, lasting, just off white head. Nose has fusty orange. Orange rind. Some pine needle. Chewy malts. Some leafy, oily herb. Taste is light, citrusy bitter. Some piny sweetness. Lovely mouthfeel. Smooth, and drinks way under the ABV. Bitterness rises and lingers, getting juicy and resinous. Didn’t expect too much from this, given it’s 12 week age, but it was very tasty and drinkable. Need to get a fresh one...
Hazy blond colour. Aroma has light sweet fruits. Very smooth and close texture. Fruity hop and caramel malts. Excellently balanced.

0.355l bottle. Clear golden body with a thin white head. Aroma of biscuit, grapefruit, honey, grassy hops and pine. Taste of bread, honey, grapefruit, lemon zest, pine and hop resin. The finish is very bitter. Very nice.

1 pint can @ home. Aroma of fresh citrus, lime/lemon grass and floral hops. Clear amber with white head, mostly lasting. Taste is moderate bitter and light+ sweet. Medium+ body, oily feel, bitter floral finish.

03/01/2016 

Aroma floral. Appearance clear, copper, frothy. Taste is light sweetness, very bitter. Palate medium body, average carbonation, long finish, with bitterness and medium dryness. Ipa with out faults, non fruity.

One of my favorites, though one does have to watch the bottle date -- since this beer is distributed widely, it tends to sit on shelves and one can easily pick up a bottle that’s over 2 years old if you aren’t watching. I’ve also noticed a lot of variation between batches -- one month, a fresh bottle will taste very fruity, the next, more bitter. Consistency aside, this is a reliably enjoyable beer. Fruity, grassy nose, bitters and fruity finish. Sometimes leaves an aftertaste that reminds me of Fruity Loops cereal, lovely!

30.05.2016, 12 oz can @ home:

Big creamy longlasting head. Aroma is strange fruity, old lawn, rotten leafs, minerals, hay, hops, old moss, bloodlike minerals, very overripe fruits, bark, pine needles, light malts, tiny hints of sulfur. Taste is slightly dry grassy, weeds, leafs, lawn, hops, moss, minerals, light malts, bark, flowers, pine needles, paper. Medium bitterness, slightly dry grassy mouthfeel. Fair enough.

On tap in the Ginger Man NYC. Amber colour, clear, thin foam. I’d say a classic style of IPA, some malt sweetness and lots of citrus pint bitterness. I had this along with several other IPAs that week in the US and have to say it didn’t stand out other than being a well made version of the style.

From a bottle in Chicago with Gurney and Joel making me basically neck it. Creamy up front, very long bitter pine/grapefruit finish. Not ideal tasting conditions but good beer.
Not at all what I expected...I don’t taste the citrus everybody else tastes. Nice smooth bre.
on tap lieve ambrato discreta nota agrumata abbastanza resinisa buona beva discreta secchezza buna intensota piena
0,33l bottle at Harry’s, Jyväskylä. Pours copper colour with a small head. Piny, caramelly and fruity aroma. Medium bitterness and body. Well balanced IPA.

Pours amber with small head. Aroma is light, some fruits, oily notes, roses, sweet flowers. Taste is light, some pine, citrus, fruits, hops, grapefruit. ABV well hidden. Quite light and therefore little bit disappointing, nothing special to me. PKGD 03/01/2016.

Can from Mikkeller & Friends bottle shop, Copenhagen. Really looking forward to this legendary IPA, which hasn’t been available in Norway yet. However, my previous experiences with American IPAs imported to Europe has been less than impressive, probably due to transportation and storage issues. So this is exciting. :-) Pours a hazy deep orange body with a medium off-white head. Nose is pine, herbs, blood oranges, citrus zest, rose water and hints of bready malts, grapefruit and light syrup. Taste is pine, citrus peel, grapefruit, herbs and hints of caramel, floral notes and resin. Medium body, medium to high carbonation. My verdict: lovely aroma, but the taste, however balanced, is not as amazing as I’d hoped for. Still, a super-solid and well brewed classic-tasting American IPA.

Can. Hazy golden color with white head. Aroma is grapefruit, piney, mango and toasted malts. Taste is quite grapefruity and more mango, quite piney, and a nice residual sweetness. Bitter finish with a toasty malt body. An extremely well-balanced IPA. Medium to high carbonation. Good! 8-4-8-4-15

Can, fresher than I used to have it, many thanks Gregor! Beautiful balance of honey, pineyness, orange, resins, some bitterness, dry finish, but not without body. Oily mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Very, very nice old school IPA, superb balance! 8-4-8-4-16
Delicious IPA. Really well balanced, incredibly drinkable. Perfect restraint in the bitterness... no hop bomb here, just a really good beer.

Bottle. Pale amber colour. Orange, pineapple, tangerines, lemon, hints of berries in the aroma. Refreshing and juicy. Oranges and tangerines all the way in the taste. Hints of other fruits. Bitterness in the end. Nice, silky palate. Juicy, rather light bodied, medium carbonated, really drinkable beer.

Can courtesy of Mr. Orla. Hazy ornage with a lasting off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and moderate hoppy - grapefruit. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish. 240516

Grapefruit, caramel, citric, pineapple, ABV well integrated.
Slightly hazy amber colour, medium off-white head, lacing.
Big resinous bite, mid-sweet, lots of grapefruit and light pineapple in the taste.
Medium body, average carbonation, bitter finish.
Longed to try this for years.

Caramel orange clear color with foam ring. Very fresh grassy and forestry nose. Creamy smooth mouth feeling and nice balanced hoppy bitterness. No tartness and a smooth silky finish and light bitter aftertaste.

Bell’s Two Hearted Ale has a thin-to-medium white head, a somewhat hazy, bubbly, orange-gold appearance, with some stringy lacing left behind. The aroma is of apricot-like hop oils and sweet, white bread. Taste is of those elements, with pronounced, but in now way harsh, bitterness. Mouthfeel is high medium, and Bell’s Two Hearted Ale finishes dry and highly drinkable. RJT

Bottle @ Gambrinus, Tartu. Pours golden/orange with small white head, doesnt stay. Aroma: citrus, grass, weak pine and resin, caramel, tropical fruits, actually theres a freshly catched and cut fish(like in a bottle), Taste: medium bitter with some sweetness, hay, mango, trpical fruits, grass, weak resin. Easy to drink. Well balanced, maybe too well. Medium body. Smooth bitter finish.Just a good IPA.

35,5cl bottle at Pudel, Tallinn. Pours almost completely clear amber with a small, off-white head. First impression is that it’s incredibly balanced and fairly smooth. Solid hoppy aroma with fruity and floral notes, light citrus, pale malt and hints of caramel. Medium to moderate sweet with complex and balanced hoppy flavours and a fine bitterness. Tasty, smooth and dangerously drinkable.
Pours hazy light golfen with a white head. Aroma; Malt, pine, citrus, resin, pineapple, bread and orange. Taste, Pineapple, citrus, pine, caramel, bread and grainy malt. Well balanced.
A: Golden coloured with a huge white head. N: Citrus, honeydew, floral T: Pine, forest, papaya notes O: Nice forest flavours! Quite easy drinking.
Has a nice refreshing very well balanced taste with lots of hops together with sweet malts and fruity characters.

50cl can: Hazy orange-golden color. Classic Centennial hop aroma wafting from the glass right away - fruity, sweet sticky tropical pineapple, raspberry, orange and cannabis. This is not a light session IPA, which is clear from the first sip. A sturdy biscuit-caramel malt complexity adds a light sweetness to the dense and abundant resinous hops. Outstanding and well-rounded.

Clear, golden-amber colored, medium frothy off white head, good lasting. Aroma is of malt, caramel, strong tropical fruits, some orange hard candy, pine. Taste is medium+ sweet malt and caramel, some orange candy, tropical fruit and pine hops, medium+ aroma, some grapefruit, moderate bitterness, dry finish, decent lasting aftertaste. Medium bodied, soft+ carbonation, resiny. Quite good but the Atlantic voyage did its part...
(bottle, Vrutak, Zagreb)

Pours a slightly hazy golden color with medium off-white head. Aroma is piney, resiny, citrusy and tropical, with a good malty/bready backbone. Taste follows the aroma, hoppy, citrusy, bready, piney and floral, with a nice bitterness on the aftertaste. Very balanced.

Bottle as an extra in a trade. I can’t find any real flaw with this beer -- it’s clean, hoppy, refreshing, and well-made -- but it also doesn’t really stand out in any way from other IPAs on the market. Nothing at all the matter with it, but something like it is probably available in half the bars in America these days.
Pours cloudy golden. Aroma is hoppy, pine. Some malt balance. Taste is nicely balanced. Hoppy, with malt slightly roasted.

Can. Light hazy golden with a large off white head with good lace and regeneration. Hoppy nose with citrus, light cheese and onion. Flavour is hop forward: Citrus, flowers, almost soap/perfume, light onion, hay, bread. Meidum body, fine carbonation, mild sweet with pleasant bitterness. Long hoppy and dry finish. Not bad, fair price too.

Tijdens IPA/Sour proeverij in de Vinotake, blik uitgeschonken in een Struise BD proefglas. Goudoranje licht troebel bier met een medium lichtbeige schuimkraag. Geurige en fruitige IPA, met aroma’s van sinaasappel, grapefruit, ananas, pijnboom, dennennaalden en kruidige groene hoptoetsen. Het smaakpallet is zeer goed gebalanceerd tussen hopbitter en zoetige karamelmout, met fruitige tonen van sinaasappelschil, limoen, grapefruit en groene kruidige tonen van dennenhars en naaldhout. Klassieke IPA, met een medium carbonatie en een bittere droge finish. Een uitstekend bier in de stijl, zeker voor herhaling vatbaar. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can. Deep golden clear. Citrussy pine, green foresty nose, caramels malty. Med bodied, well bittered. Malty caramels, slight huskyness (as warm..). Clean nice bitter ipa.

-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Can @hotel room, Copenhagen, post CBC. 
Pours golden color with a thick white head. 
Pine, resin, tropical fruits I aroma. Nice malty backbone. Some balancing sweetness, floral notes, hops, pine. 
Pleasant beer.

Bottle, 355ml. A clear amber beer with a small white head. Floral aroma of hops, citrics and a hint of mint. Taste is bitter with some carbonation and astringency. Medium bodied, dry and with a strong hoppy finish. Very nice character with citrics like grapefruit.

Bottle, 355ml. Clearish golden with a creamy head with nice lacing. Aromas of floral hops, tangerine, caramel, resin. Medium to robust bodied with moderate carbonation. Medium sweet with heavy bitterness. Highly astringent. Intense and complex fruity and hoppy flavors into a bitter hoppy finish. Excellent.

330 ml bottle, bottled 03/01/16, from Saveur Bière. Thanks to Werckmeister!

Amber, moderate hazy body, with a big, fluffy, lacing, off-white head.

Aroma of grapefruit juice, citrus, orange, pine, passion fruit, pineapple, flowers, caramel, biscuit.

Tastes follows this, also quite juicy, with enough bitterness and malt body.

Medium, oily mouthfeel, with an average carbonation.

Finishes bitter, medium dry, fruity, citric, zesty, floral, piney, with some biscuit.



Tasty. Quaffable and greatly balanced between juicy fruits, bitterness, dryness and a smooth malt body. Not the most extraordinary IPA, but just how I like this style, while not among my favourite examples.

Can from Cotteridge Wines; clear amber pour with a big frothy off white head, aroma has pine and tangerine, taste has tangerine, resinous pine, bitter grapefruit, some mellow well balanced sweet malts, light carbonation.

355 ml. can @ Gollem. Lightly hazy orange with a creamy off-white head. Nose is classical, well-balanced DIPA, orange peel, pine resin, touch less fruity, touch more on the bitter edge, faint herbal but very restrained, balanced & enjoyable, low caramel. Taste is balanced mellow pine, caramel malts, orange peel, balanced, mellow easy, low fruity but in a good way, nothing overly aggressive, great balanced, low herbal touch in finish, finish carries low increase in bitterness; very easy to drink & massively enjoyable. This is a current & future classic, great balance, super easy to drink, very welcoming & it comes in a can. Great exercise in drinkability & balance in my opinion, just very pleasing. At good price & availability I would make this a staple despite not being the biggest DIPA fan (I like but just not a massively as every other beer geek).

Hazy golden orange color. Aroma is dominated by pine, orange, grapefruit with some grassy/herbal notes. Taste follows through. Exceptional mouthfeel; manages to be clean and refreshing in the finish, despite strong flavors. Great American IPA, on the piney and dank (rather than tropical) side. It’s a treat to drink.

can from online web order, poured a deep golden colour with a creamy white head. nose is quite malt forward, citrus, tropical fruits, caramel sweet malts, taste is quite sweet, tropical fruits, citrus, malt forward, crisp. bit overrated

From Labirratorium. In Teku glass. Watching Cosmopolis. Specially refreshing. Great balance between bitterness and a pleasant fruityness, and very smooth. Only downside is that its great flavor is not long lasting
bottle 4/19/16. Hazy gold pour. Aroma grassy citrus. Tastes bitter, herbs floral. clean. But not exceptional at all. Why is this so well rated?!

Burk från Mikkeller webshop. Drygt två år gammal och kanske lite trött humle. Men kvaliteten lyser ändå igenom. Mycket fin ganska komplex doft som är blommig, gräsig och fruktig. Snyggt välbalanserad smak, blommig, gräsigt och lite citrusfruktigt. Ganska torr och krispig men samtidigt mjuk och rund, maltkropp imponerar. Riktigt bra närmast arketypisk östkust-IPA

Servida en un Spiegelau IPA. APARIENCIA: de color ámbar con destellos naranjas a contraluz, se observa turbia y moderada actividad de carbonatación; corona de espuma color blanco de buena retención, copiosa, de burbujas compactas y abiertas.

AROMA: muy frutal, lúpulos americanos de carácter frutal es lo que predomina, notas a frutos tropicales, mango, duraznos, piña, el dulzor de las maltas se alcanza a percibir.

SABOR: de entrada un amargor medio seguido de notas herbales y resinosas de los lúpulos, algunas notas ligeramente cítricas y dulzor de maltas que no es empalagoso y que se complementa bien; en el retrogusto queda un amargor de intensidad media, el cual es seco.

SENSACIÓN: cuerpo medio con sensación oleosa, carbonatación media.

RESUMEN: Excelente cerveza de acuerdo al estilo.

A hazy golden orange color with a nice white head. Aroma is full of citrus and tropical fruit. The malt brings some of the sweetness of the hops out. Bitterness is average but well balanced. Great beer. Medium body. Great mouthfeel

Pours clear amber with a medium frothy white head. Aromas of peach, gooseberry, citrus, grass, pine, resin. Taste is a good balance between fruitiness, floral notes and malty sweet backbone. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation.

Can@Desverger. Pours hazy golden orange with a white head. Aroma and taste is malt, tropical fruits, tangerine, citrus fruits, hops, caramel sweetness, grapefruit, pine needles, Smooth mouthfeel. Medium body. Bitter hoppy finish.

Appearance: clear pale amber, one finger of rocky off-white head diminishing rapidly to a thin skim, patchy lacing. (3/5) Aroma: pine resin, pithy grapefruit, pale malt, light floral/herbal. (7/10) Taste: moderate sweet, moderately strong bitter. (8/10) Medium-full body, moderate carbonation, lingering bitter and slightly sticky finish. (4/5)

My initial reaction was one of slight disappointment - I mean, come on, this beer is fairly legendary! Perhaps not to the extent of, say, Heady Topper, or Pliny, but it’s up there. When I uncapped it, though, the initial aroma was not as penetrating as I was expecting or hoping for. However, once I started drinking it, the flavours started to build and assert themselves. Not as citrusy as a lot of current A/IPAs, the resiny pine really dominates this. Finishes strong, with just enough malt sweetness to balance the moderately high bitterness. (And, to be fair, at three months old it’s entirely possible that the aromas have faded significantly. Might have to try it again if I can find a newer one.) (15/20)

Would like to taste Imperial version of this. Very nice, solid, balanced, but kinda lacks some hit. Decent maltiness, nice hop cocktail with grapefruit and orange prevail, some herbal aspect. Light sweetness with moderate bitterness.
Very solid and enjoyable

July 26, 2015. Bottle at Rattle ’N’ hum, bottled June 5. 

Cloudy golden with a medium sized white head. Aroma is sweet malty and fruity with toffee, resin, peach, oranges, some spicy floral notes. Taste is medium sweet, biscuity, resinous, some candied peaches, pine and grass medium bitterness. Finish is slight dry piney bitter with some malty sweetness in the back. Medium bodied, average carbonation.

More malt forward than I expected. Strong chewy toffee, with the fruit providing balance rather than bursting in at the outset. Light copper, with a big white head and lacing. Big body, neither oily nor creamy. When the hops come through they provide grapefruit, mango, resin and herbs. Tastes really good - aroma doesn’t stand out quite so much.

Stor vit krona, Ljus bärnsten, små bubblor, kådig frisk humledoft, balanserad fantastisk smak av kåda, karamell, tallbar massa frisk humle & fin beska, en riktig törstsläckare 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Fantastic aroma of oranges, citrus, grass and grape fruit. Pours golden with a tall solid head. Taste of blood orange and grape fruit. Feels quite thin and lively. Quite short. Lovely beer.

Can canned 22. 02. 2016. Orange amber body with nice light tan head. Aroma is floral with herbs, citrus and some resin. Taste is also very herbal with some subtle malts in the background. Aftertaste is nice bitter. Very nice one.
Very nice IPA, normally not a big fan of IPA, but this beer changed my mind. Where have you been all my Life?

Courtesy of Jaghana. Couleur orangée, légère mousse. Nez fort houblonné sapin, fruits exotiques confits, caramel blond. Gout fruité, houblonné floral, herbes sèches, résine, amertume amande, caramel blond, longue amertume en fin de bouche. Très bonne ipa mais un peu surcotée....

Can 50cl, a copper amber beer with good head and nice lace work. Nose is very intense on blond caramel, hop resin, fresh exotic fruits. Aroma is on resin, vanilla, blond caramel, coconut oily, quite round, touch of quince, apples, quite rich body, good complexity,
Pours a nice deep amber color. Aromas of hops/hops/citrus. Strong hop flavors with malts and a dry finish.
This IPA is hands down one of the tops that I have ever drank in my life. There is nothing bad about this beer.

16 fl oz can from Beer Gonzo. Pours an orange-gold amber colour with a creamy foam head leaving lots of lacing. Aroma of tropical fruits, mango, citrusy, hop resins. Taste is malt caramel balanced with juicy fruits, floral citrus, grapefruit, resiny, pine and spicy hop bitterness. Smooth mouthfeel, medium bodied, soft carbonation, lingering dry tangy bitter finish. Very drinkable.

Pint can from Beer Gonzo, Coventry. Strong citrus, pine, lemon, grapefruit aroma. Taste is leaning towards the herbal side, nice tropical
Background, caramel malt with a decent bitter finish, but not too bitter. Can understand the hype completely.

1 pint can at home in Richmond, as ’Bells Two Hearted Ale’, 7%, under 3 months since canning. Dark brick orange, translucent, lightly sparkling, huge dense foamy cream head leaves very uniform lacing. Aroma is fresh and fruity - some pineapple and tangerine. Body is a little frothy and fizzy. Taste is toffee-sweet, strong piney hops, resin, candyfloss, grassy finish with a touch of spice, mint and booze. A real pine bomb. Good.
Aroma: fruity and hoppy; Appearance: amber with fluffy white head that lingers; Taste: fruity - but was influenced by lemon problem at Flying Saucer; Overall: need to re-rate.

Bottle@home, from Wine Spot, Cleveland, USA. Medium/strong, wide aroma with sweeter malts and fruits in a balanced combination. Golden color with orange nuances on it. Medium, natural white head and slightly hazy liquid. Medium, balanced taste with sweet malts, apricot and quite a lot of hops. Fruity sweetness and malty aromas are in perfect combination, something between IPA and APA. Wide/medium taste spectrum and medium malty, slightly fruity aftertaste. Medium body with medium/light carbonation. Overall, more maltiness makes this product a bit different. Superb implementation makes it almost perfect.

Bottle. Stinky socks aroma. Thick mouthfeel dry noble hops then more and more layers slowly of bready hoppiness. Palate is long balanced hops. Not a palate wrecker whatsoever. Great ipa with a funky aroma.
From a can. Beautiful head. Golden. Fresh citrus taste. A bit watery. Nice bitterness.

Pours clear golden with low white head 
Aromas hoppy of citrusy fruits , bread, caramel 
Taste has notes of biscuits, bready malts, tropical fruits, caramel, resin, soap
Mouthfeel is medium bodied, carbonation, sweetness,bitterness
10 year feastings. Pours clear golden with a large white head which lingers. Aroma is caramel, mango and tropical fruit. Taste is grassy, bitter, malty sweet, mango sweet, medium bitter finish.
Can at Craigs. Pours clear golden amber with a thick white head. Aromas of resinous hops, crystal malt. Taste is bitter, green plant stalks. Bitter finish.
Can.Hazy Orange with large fluffy head.Aroma strong fruity of Pineapples,mango and oranges juice,strong taste of dry bitter hops and light sweet finish with note of honey and tropical fruits.
Surprising light but fresh citrus/pine aroma. Tastes clean and citrusy, hints of pine, hints of caramel. Very well balanced and not overpowering. Clean and fresh and very nice and good.

Can shared with Niller, sourced from Mikkeller Bottle Shop, Copenhagen - hazy orange amber coloured pour with white head. Aroma and taste is a medley of fresh juicy tropical and citrus fruits, hoppy and malty, some caramel sweetness, tangerine, grapefruit and peach, pine needles, hoppy bitter finish. Canned only a couple of months ago, highly drinkable, gorgeous brew.

Pours dark golden color, clear, almost brilliant, with mousse-like off-white two fingers head. Visually mdium carbonation. Aroma: intense hop aroma, with notes of citruses, pine, florals...
Flavor: rich, intense; biscuit and honey like malt flavors, perfectly balanced with hop flavors, which takes on pine, citruses and flovers...
Finish is slightly dry, bitter and lingers long in aftertaste.
Hop bitterness is high. Body is moderate medium, carbonation is medium, texture is soft. Representative sample of ipa style (7-4-8-4-17=4.1)
Re-rate from can, bottled on 22.2.16: fresh, like I would smell and taste Centennial pelets. F...awsome! (7-5-9-5-17=4.3)

duft appelsin mandarin sødlig frisk frugtig
smag: frisk juice sødlig frisk appelsin svag svag bitterhd

330ml can (thanks martjoobolut). Clear amber color. Medium size, white head, stays. Fruity, orange, citrus, marmalade, pine needles, sweet in aroma. Sweet, fruity, citrus, mango, syrup in taste. Tropical fruits and spicy hops in aftertaste. Soft crisp carbonation. Juicy mouthfeel. Quite drinkable.

(355ml bottle packaged 03/01/16, VilleValla Pub, Linköping, April 22 2016) Pours a slightly murky dark orange-gold with a dense and stable white head. Aroma has quite floral and almost soapy hop character, with pine and spruce needles, citrus peels, resin, some tropical fruit behind, and caramel malts, hefty. Flavour matches the nose, with a soapy hop profile with conifer needles, florals and citrus peels to the fore, some caramel sweetness and tangerine, slight breadiness to the malt. Light to moderate bitterness for style, lingering malt sweetness. Fairly full and oily body, low carbonation. Not as bright and juicy as the IPA style tends towards these days, more malt and pine, but nicely done. Should try it fresher I think.

Bottle. Pours clear golden with a white head. Aroma of honey dew, peach, quite tropical, light biscuit, light caramel, pine, citrus, grape. Taste is medium sweet, fruity, light peach. Citrus and grape. Lacks bitterness tho a fine craft

perfect appearnce of darker golden colour and huge, dense, long lasting head; aroma of tropical fruits, some apricot, celery, floral notes, resins, bread and earth; perfectly balanced bittersweet taste with celery, tropical fruits, biscuits, apricot and hints of honey; great IPA

355ml can - thanks martjoobolut! (6+:3:7+:4:15=2.5++) canned 022916

Maybe my detergents are weird, but this reminds me of doing the washing up, piney and citrus. Sweetness comes from tinned peaches and pineapple. Pale orange, small brief head. Delicious toffee malts, fruity zesty hops. Perfect balance between malts, aromatic citrussy piney hops, and nettley zesty bitter hops. Shame about the negative connotations from the aroma, this is a gorgeous fresh IPA. Covers 7% very well indeed. Well done Bells, this reminds me of my first Hopslam experience years ago - I’m actually excited by an American IPA!

Can, canned 29.02.2016. (from mikkeller webshop). Pours golden. Aroma is hoppy, citrus, mango, pineapple. Flavor is sweet and bitter, citrus, tangerines, mango. Finish is dry-pine bitter. Overall: nice.

12oz can, shared by Mart. Clear orange amber beer, small white head. Nose is citric, fruity, mango, spruce. Flavor is lots of spruce, pineapple, peaches. Hoppy finish, resin, peaches and pineapple. Oily mouthfeel. Nice one.

Can. Clear golden pour with thick offwhite head. Aroma has citrus and grass. Quite anonymous. Taste is very balanced but still fresh and pungent. Ends with a bit of bitterness. Low carbonation. Full body

Kolor złoty. Idealna klarowność znana u większości amerykańskich kultowych browarów.
Piana drobna, falująca, pokrywająca gęstą pajęczyną całą powierzchnię szklanki.
Aromat nie powala swoją intensywnością jak na piwo 100/100 według RateBeer.
Niemniej jednak przeważają nuty sosnowego drewna, a wraz z nimi aromat lasu i żywicy.
Jeśli ktokolwiek miałby kiedyś problem z wyczuciem sosny w piwie, to z pewnością poleciłbym mu ten egzemplarz.
Po drugiej stronie znajdują się owoce tropikalne (mango, marakuja).
W oddali pikantne oraz subtelnie przyprawowe niuanse.
Aromat czysty, chmielowy bez żadnych wad i niedomówień.
Mocny, konkretny ziołowo-owocowy smak.
Na jezyku przewija się od grejpfuta, przez mango i papaję, a na mandarynkach i gorzkich pomarańczach skończywszy.
Mocna chmielowa goryczka, ni kszty nie zalegająca. Czysty, rześki i świeży finisz.
Umiarkowane wysycenie i odpowiednio gęsta faktura.
Bez zbędnego owijania w bawełnę. Fenomenalne IPA! Jedno z najlepszych jakie piłem i z pewnością wzorowy wyznacznik stylu.

Draft at the Flying Saucer, Nashville. Pours a clear amber hue with a white head and copious amounts of lacing. Aroma of citrus, tropical fruit, pine, and malt. Taste is similar to nose. Great balance. Tap lines may have altered the taste to some extent, will need to re-rate.

Bottle from Mikkeller Webshop. Pours slightly hazy orange with frothy white head. Intense hop aroma with spruce, pine needle, tropical fruit, orange marmalade and tangerine. Taste is a mild balance between pine needles, citrus and orange marmalade with sweetish malty backbone. Nicely balanced and easy drinking.
Bottle at home. Straw yellow colour with a small white head. Nose is tangerine. Taste is low sweetness medium bitterness with a distinct tangerine tase. Probaly (one of) the best ipa I?ve ever had.

Can - about 7 weeks old. 
Aroma of pine, citrus, lemon peel, flowers, slight malty sweetness. 
Pours clear golden, frothy almost two finger white head. 
Taste is medium bitter and medium sweet - very balanced. 
Medium body, sticky texture, good average carbonation, medium bitter and sweet fruity finish. Not a traditional west coast or east coast IPA - a good mix. Centennial is not my favourite hop but although a very solid and well crafted IPA.
Can. Amber with a white head that disapears quick. Floral and grassy aroma with some malt. Taste is floral but balanced with a bitter ending. A good example of a balanced IPA.
Довольно качественный IPA с ярким цветочным, хмелевым ароматом, свежим, средней плотности телом и хрустящим послевкусием. Ощутимый солодовый вкус. Приятное образец.

This is my favorite beer. It smells like a good beer should, and it comes looking like a good amber ale with a nice perfect head every time. It then precedes to go down smoothly with a nice medium body and a lovely finish.

(47 cl can from Mikkeller Bottleshop; Pked 022216) Poured at fridge temperature into a Maisel & Friends footed tulip glass reveals a mostly clear amber body with two finger, creamy white head. Decent retention and beautiful lace. Aroma is hopforward and fresh with notes of citrus and pine. Oily texture, medium carbonation, light body and a very well balanced finish. Flavour follows the nose and is only moderately bitter yet crisp and full of hoppy notes. Well composed, interestingly complex yet easily drinkable.

Bottle at Bishops Folkis.
Clear golden with a big fluffy off white head. Nice lace.
Grapefruit, bright caramel and resin with a pinch of melon, cucumber and vanilla in the aroma.
Grapefruit and caramel in a balanced mix with pineneedles and zest in the finish. Medium sweet maltiness.
Medium to bigger body, soft carbonation, soft texture.
Nice and balanced. Old school.
Amber with small white head. Rich fruity aroma with hoppy notes. Rich sweet-sour fruity (citrus, melon, mango) taste followed by strong hoppy bitterness. Strong bitter aftertaste with fruity notes.

Yum! On tap. Golden honey in the glass. Great white head dies and leads to some great lacing. Nice is citrus and a hint of pine resin. Palate is a great balance of citrus hop notes, piney hop goodness. The balance is perfect. The finish didn’t leave me wanting. Great expression of the IPA style. Yum!

Canned. Pours clear deep golden with an average off-white head. Aroma of grapefruit, lemon zest, floral hops and caramel notes. Sweet flavor that ends up dry and nice bitter. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. A great, crisp IPA. 🌟🌟🌟🌟

I really really like this IPA. It has everything. Aroma, taste, lacing and overall enjoyment. I can’t stop whiffing it. If you see it buy it. If it’s on tap forgettaboutit...your drinking this all night.

(Backlog) Can pour at home, thanks Andrew for sharing this one. Amber pour, pine hop aroma, this is a good beer that shows different styles of beer within the same "style" and by t that I mean there are a lot of similar taste with this and a west coast style but also a lot of different things,mainly one being the amount of bite you get. Love trying Bells any time I can.

Huge citrus pine aroma in an amber pour. Brilliantly balanced with laid back bitterness perfectly complimented by a full fruity body. Finish is sustained and massively ’moreish’! Has to be one of the best brews of the style I’ve had - and I’ve had a few. A brilliant beer - no ifs, ands, or buts!

Golden clear white head 
Aroma of citrus hops almondy 
Taste mild and bitter grapefruit nice texture

Aroma: resinous, heavy pine, honey, molasses. Appearance: clear, pale gold, small, creamy, white head. Taste: medium bitter. Palate: heavy pine, floral hops, touch of exotic fruits, peaches, tangerine, quite intense resin. Overall: very nice IIPA. great resinous flavours. Bottle at Rattle ’n’ Hum 33rd, Manhattan.

Ar- stunning floral aroma with hints of perfume and citrus

Ap- clear Amber with a string white head

Fl- extremely well balanced, hint of malt sweetness is quickly joined by earthy, floral, and hints of citrus and bitterness. Finished dog smooth and dry. 

Mf- med-full bodied, soft, round, slight carbonation, 

Ov- such a great beer. A beer can be balanced and a lot are but when a beer really shines is when the components being balanced are standouts by themselves. This is what you get here. I'd like a tad more carbonation on the mouthfeel. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Appearance: Pours golden cloudy with a small head and lace. Nose: Citrus, Hops and floral. Mouth/Feel: Crisp, Clean and fresh. Taste: Orange Peel, Pine followed by a balanced Hop floral finish. I’ve been putting off drinking this beer and always grabbed “the beer” next to it. Well it was the last solider standing and man what a surprise/treat. A very enjoyable Ale that I will pick up again. Overall: 4.1 out of 5

16oz can (Courtesy of Headbanger) poured into a Shaker at 42°. Color is a bright golden with good carbonation giving it a fluffy white head. Aroma is faint, giving just a hint of hops and maybe some fruit. It has a medium body with a crisp mouth feel. Flavor is malt and honey with a light hop spice and mild bitterness. In the after taste the malt hangs on with a very light roasted taste coming though. Overall its a little too malty and the hops don’t show much for an IPA.
Pours copper. Dried apricots come to mind up front with a floral finish. Dense head. Good balance and very drinkable.

Pours pure gold. Surprising light but fresh citrus/pine aroma. Tastes clean and citrusy, hints of pine, hints of caramel. Very well balanced and not overpowering. Clean and fresh and very nice and good.

Fourth beer of the five Matt bought back from San Diego. Light brown with sudsy white bubbly head. Smell is fragrant floral hop, light crisp malt. Taste is very resinous hop, moderate malt, faint corn. Body is slick and bitter. Nose is floral and delicate, taste is massive resin. Big and bitter and very nice but don't think it quite lives up to its 4.05 rating.

Bottle from Bottlecraft in SD at home in HK. Clear-ish amber pour, quickly dissipating head. Aroma is bitter pine tree hops, some peach. Taste is also very pine hop forward, with some more rounded fruitiness underneath. Good amount of malt to balance. Very solid but not as good as I remember.

16 oz can poured. Huge thanks to my brother for the can. Always wanted to try this, and never got the chance to. Clear golden copper pour with a ton of foam head and lace. Fruity and floral hop aroma. Flavor is delicious and fruity. Such clean flavor. Subtle floral hips with hardly any bitterness. Such an easy drinking, deliciuis, and memorable IPA. Wish this was a regular option for me

Dark gold color, lively carbonation, white dissipating head. We’ve all had IPAs with a much livelier aroma than this, but not many are this drinkable. Grapefruit and not much else on the aroma. But still, great flavor, not too bitter but still very nice and crisp. I’m loving it.

Hazy orange gold. Thick off white head. Skunky funky juicy citrus hop aroma. Nice malty backbone. Jammy upfront with gradual bitterness in the mid and strongly bitter to close. Citrus aftertaste. Some grapefruit citrus flavor and a touch of apricot. Cloying mouthfeel.

One pint can. Nice!!! 1/11/16 date

clear orange amber color. Bright white head. Leaves a thick and sticky collar. 
Nose is a bit soft. Citrus, caramel, grain, does smell quite juicy though. 
Taste is big juicy fruit, soft caramel, soft bitterness. Makes up for it in the feel, very long lasting. Lots of oil. Lots of orange and other citrus. Amazing body. Very clean.
Ámbar turbio y espuma blanca compacta. Aromas florales, cítricos, pino. Cuerpo denso y maltoso, sabor cítrico, pino y final de amargor seco.
Orange-gold pour with a tight white head. Sweet orangey, piney aroma, nice malt underneath. Sweet, juicy citrus and tropical fruit, caramel, very good
Loads of citrus and a bit of sweetness on the nose. The taste is tropical fruit and caramel. Nicely balanced.

270116. Bells Brewery is fast becoming one of my favourite breweries and if they keep producing beers like this then it will quickly jump to the top of the list. There is a lot of butterscotch and fresh cut flowers in the aroma of this beer and in the mouth it is smooth and malty with butterscotch and caramel coming through. Awesome beer that I bought from Beer Cartel.

Rating #1587 - 22.03.2015 - On tap at the Commons ale house in Santa Monica, it figures that live closer to this brewery and they have distribution in Cali. Pours a rich golden amber, small white head, minimal lacing. Aroma is orange zest, tangerine. On the palate, similar tropical flavours, mild resin, mild pine needle. Medium bodied and extraordinarily balanced.
Amber color with a minimal white head. Aroma is hoppy and slightly malty. Taste is nicely balance with the hops coming through just enough to say this is not your average IPA. Well done!

Too much bittering hop for me. Nice classic piney aroma with good malt, nice color. But the taste is just too bitter to be a great IPA. This is like an OG style IPA that gained prominence 5-10 years ago. Now things have moved toward more fruit, more pungent aroma, new types of hops. I think it turns out I just never liked this style of IPA.
16oz can. Pours Golden hazy orange with off-white head. Aroma is sweet floral and citrus. Taste is sweet malty floral happiness with a citrus hoppy finish. Very balanced and delicious.

Classic daily go to. Beautiful grapefruit,orange aroma and taste. Taste has significant malt sweetness which is nice. Aldo some nice floral notes in the mix. Famously balanced beer. Seems to be better in cans. ** Also, do not follow this beer with another IPA, it will taste 'off' after having this one. Maybe it's the Centenial hops but it's a palate wrecker. Learned this the hard way.

The beer has a copper/amber color with a medium head. Aroma has a lot of fruit like mangos and some pears. Taste has a lot of fruit for an IPA. There is a tropical taste up front followed with some malts and a mild bitterness. Great balance and beer.

I think I broke my palate for IPAs. A "well balanced" IPA comes across as overly-malty to me. I like the aroma a little more than the taste. Still a nice beer, just not what I’m looking for in an IPA right now.

Amber to copper in color with a good light tan head. Intense mandarin/peach aroma. Wonderful lacing in glass. Good carbonation and light mouthfeel. Strong citrus flavor with slight bitterness. More of a refreshing IPA without the drying bitterness of most IPAs. Lasting finish balanced of sweet and bitter. On a personal note I really enjoy this beer on its own or with a meal. Slightly higher ABV, but not overpowering alcohol.
Hazy Amber foamy Lacy beige head; aroma is wonderful flowery hop spice; flava is hoppy grainy with floral notes; feels medium moderate fizz; finishes dry bitter hoppy
Bottle. Orange gold with a nice frothy white head. Aroma of floral and citrus with grapefruit and caramel flavor. Medium light bitterness with a smooth finish.. Very nice.

Pours a very light orange with a small head with moderate lacing. Nose is floral with hints of tangerines. Medium body, heavy carbonation, velvet texture. Palate is dry, floral, and bitter. Bitter afterstaste. B@H

I’m earmarking this beer as one to get the next time I see it on a menu or something, because at the time I drank it, I hated IPAs. Now, I think any positivity I have toward it wouldn’t be based on its reputation, it’d be because I actually like the style now and think this would be great.

Bottle; pours clear amber with a khaki head; aroma of citrus fruits, and pine with hints of caramel and grass; taste is citrus and caramel with a little pine grass; bitter finish with a little more citrus; excellent beer

Slightly hazy, orange colour, medium head. Moderate aroma of citrus fruits, floral and caramel base. Taste is medium sweet, under medium bitter and medium long duration finish. Over medium body. Soft to medium carbonation. Legendary IPA, 100/100, but for me...it’s rather dissapointing beer. Decent, maybe even quite good IPA, but not awesome indeed. Moderate aroma, bitterness could be stronger.
I hear bells ringing when I drink this! Don’t be afraid to pair this fragrant ale with your main dish... it’s mouth watering.

Bottle in LA dated 13/10/15. Pours clear pale amber with small fading head. Big juicy hop aroma, what seems like alcohol sweetness there too, smells like an imperial IPA. Tropical fruit and grapefruit in the hop flavour, juicy, some floral hops, a little grassiness. Medium-high carbonation, creamy. Solid bitterness. Terrific IPA.

Aroma is floral but somewhat weak. But not in a bad way. It's very balanced and very floral. Great beer. When paired against toppling Goliath pseudo sue it falls short. But very close

Bottle thanks to trade. Hop aroma’s that fade very very quickly (say, 1 minute after opening the bottle it’s gone). Lots of malts, and a good bitter bite, but no fruitiness or tropicalness. It’s ok. Not special.

Bright orange colour with snow white head. Lacing till the end of glass. Moderate carbonation which brings fruity centennial hop aromas with hint of some spiceness almost like corriander. Great balance between malts and moderate bitternes for an AIPA. Great beer and wish to have one every day. These guys know what a great IPA is and they made it. Thank you Sandra & Thomas H.

Bottle. Tropical fruit hop aroma with piney and grapefruit citrus hops notes as well. Pours cloudy golden colored with a large, soapy white head with good retention and lacing. Starts with piney hop bitterness and grapefruit citrus. Finishes dry with sweet pineapple fruitiness with a little bit piney hop bitterness remaining as well as a bit of grapefruit acidity. Excellent, well balanced IPA.
Slightly hazy good carbonation and thick white head. Nice dank citrusy aroma. Malt

CAN. Poured a hazy straw with small flat white head.. Sweet fruit hops on the nose,thinking tutti fruity chewing gum?.. Sweet fruity hops for sure, passionfruit & pineapple definitely are a strong presence, good hoppy finish.. Sourced RW
Probably the single best ale I’ve ever had. The aroma is awesome and the finish is strong.

Pretty good IPA. I couldn’t think of much to write about this one, but I finally had a chance to try some and wanted to get some basic thoughts down. It’s usually not been available in my area and is too expensive at it’s regular price here, but I found some that were available and on sale. It didn’t blow me away, but there were no noticeable deficiencies- good hops profile with the expected amount of hops, not watery, etc.. Definitely a good solid IPA that any IPA drinker should find a reasonable representation of the style, and a lot better than the rush of beers we see getting labeled IPAs for marketing reasons that aren’t true IPAs. This is a true IPA. Having said that, I don’t understand what the hype is about, really- it’s not anything spectacular except in the way that a good IPA is always spectacular to people who like IPAs. I would give a slight edge to the Sierra Nevada Torpedo on taste, and, in my area, I can get 12 of those for $3.50 more than 6 of these cost (with no 12 packs available locally) when both are at the regular prices. On sale, it was a fine value, but I can’t think of a reason to buy this over a Torpedo when it’s not on-sale, and it passes over the 6-pack spending limit I’ve set for myself at it’s regular price. Now, perhaps the regular pricing listed was because it’s new to my area or outside their core midwestern distribution heartland (Brewery is in Michigan) or whatever, and it’s a bit less expensive closer to the brewery relative to it’s national competition- in which case I would totally understand why this is a lot of people’s go-to everyday beer.
cloudy reddish amber with medium head. lively carbonation hint of citrus smell. Plenty of hops. but not overpowering. A bit of a grapefruit-like after taste. Rather crisp and refreshing India ale.

Deep orange color with a thick white head. Aroma pine, citrus, malt. Wonderful hop bitterness balanced with a nice malt sweetness. Really good. I could drink this all night.

Bottle 35,5cl / Botella 35,5cl.
@ Friendly Greek, Lancaster, PA, USA
A: Hazy golden / Dorado turbio
T/S: Hops, fruity, citrusy / Lupulo, afrutado, citrico.

Balance. Two hearts combine harmoniously to marry hop and malt. Big hops heavily countered by massive malts constitutes balance, making this very easy to drink. Smells of flowers with a bit of grass. Tastes orangey and light but feels thick and malty with a huge sweetness. Unlike most IPAs, this one finishes sweet with a hint of bitter. It’s like a mandarin orange. Mouthfeel is just right for all day drinking; decent lacing and a mild lingering in the mouth. The flavor that lingers is fruity orange peel, so it’s more thatn pleasant. Great beer, well done Bells.

Poured form a 16 oz can, canned on 9/9/15, into a glass clear orange yellow with a light tan head. Pine and citrus blossom in they mouth and balanced very nicely, with very mild bitter finish. This is a great gateway beer, to introduce IPA’s to non IPA drinkers.

16 fl oz can from Firma Bier, canned in January 2015 (eight months old). Clear, golden orange with a huge, frothy, almost stable, tan head. Fruity-resiny aroma of mango, pine and honey. Sweetish, fruity-resiny taste of mango, honey and pine, followed by a smooth, mildly bitter and only covertly grapefruity finish. Medium to full body, very creamy and smooth mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Very sweet IPA, rather fruity but unexpectedly mild. Prominent malt profile, actually screaming for more hops. Still very good but again I assume this beer is already past its prime.

Poured from a bottle. Pours a nice copper gold with white head. Hoppy, citrus aromas. Full mouth feel. Flavors like the aromas: orangey citrus, hops, some pine. Some lingering bitterness. Very balanced and a great beer overall.

Pours hazy orange with thin white head. Beautiful aroma of tropical fruit and apricot. Smooth mouthfeel with slightly sweet grapefruit taste transitioning to a bitter finish that lasts for days. Excellent IPA.

As ales go this is definitely the best I have ever had. Pours hazy sunshine gold, aroma erupts from the bottle with the scent of freshly cut grass and orange blossoms. Taste is just right, bitterness not too heavy not too light, sweetness is just right. Has a medium body with a touch of creaminess. just a touch of carbonation. the taste does not make me go WOW, but it does make me say Hay, this is just right! finishes smoothly with no excessive after taste. Overall this beer it just right.
This is one of the best beers I have had. Another success from the Bell brewery. It could be a long night.

Aroma: grass, floral, citrus, pine

Excellent

Can at home. Nicely cloudy, light golden colour with a creamy white head. Hop profile is orange zesty, grapefruit, citrus and resinous on top of a nicely grainy, moderately sweet malty base. Finish is citrus fruity and bitter, but without any tardness, clean. Good body, low carbonation, soft palate.

On tap at Archive. Pours light amber with sustained frothy head. Aroma of orange peel from the hops which spice up the taste. It finishes with pleasant light bitterness on the palate. Worth a revisit closer to the source

Pours a hazy brownish yellow with a foamy white head. Moderate malty aroma. Taste of citrus rind and some malts with a moderate bitterness. Lingering aftertaste like quinine. Too bitter without enough flavor to balance it out.

33cl bottle thanks to a friend that brought it from the US. Color is light gold to orange. Head is thin to medium and persistent and white. Body is super smooth and finishes dry and a bit sweet. Aroma is malty, hoppy, resin and herby. Flavour is resin, spicy, hoppy, pinneapple, wood, light malt. Best IPA I ever had. Yet :-)

Bell’s famous and renowned IPA hopped only with Columbus, one of the three great American C-hops and known for its Cascade-like orange aroma combined with more bittering power. Moussy, egg-white, irregularly lacing head forming ’islands’ of foam and retaining very well on the edges, draped over a ’sunny’, warm pale orange coloured, clear beer with strains of fine bubbles here and there, turning into a warm and equal ’orange mist’ with deposit. Dank but elegantly hoppy, enticing aroma of pink grapefruit flesh, fresh orange peel, pine needles, hemp, medium grilled pork, home made caramel, red raspberry, toasted bread and hints of roasted peanuts, field flowers, green olives, minerals, sundried tomato, capers in olive oil, hint of chicken broth. Refinedly fruity, edged onset of soft tropical fruits (pineapple, mango) with already a subtle ’announcement’ of grapefruity hoppiness to come, minerally with a subtle saltiness, soft and lean, slick body built from biscuity, very lightly toasted malts, ending in a splendour of elegant yet powerful, drying, piney, grapefruity, floral hop bitterness, resiny and ’sec’ but still leaving a trace of juicy, caramelly malt sweetishness underneath, while a faint caper-like saltiness keeps lingering as well, without disturbing me. This is indeed almost as good as it gets for a ’regular’ IPA: perfectly in balance, visually attractive, quenching and extremely elegant. The bitterness goes on for a long time, but does not become abrasive or agressive anywhere. I am glad I got the chance to taste this, this is nowhere extreme, but balanced to perfection, like many of Bells’ beers. I fully understand now how this got its reputation, even though it is dark and rainy outside, this beer makes me dream of a brightly sunny afternoon. Would love to taste one fresh from tap, though.

Ragyogó szépsége bármely IPA becsületére válna, vastag, krémes habja a mulandóság legapróbb jelét sem szolgáltatja. A krémesség illatának is központi összetevője, aszalt sárgabarack, alma, mangó aromái olvadnak elegáns egységbe, majd ugyanezek a komponensek mesteri módon, átmenet nélkül bukkannak fel immár ízlelőbimbóinkon, kiegészülve kerekre szabott, szellősen elszórt buborékokkal óvatosan megkent keretben elhelyezkedő szalmásan malátás, angolosan száraz ízjegyekkel. Kiegyensúlyozott, remekül összeállított, extrákat valóban nélkülöző, ámde kifogástalan és komplex főzet. A tartalmas testhez mondandóval telt utóíz kapcsolódik, a karcosan egyedi kesernye a kortyolás közbeni benyomásoktól elválaszthatatlan módon, magától értetődő természetességgel jelenik meg, majd időzik el hosszasan.
12 fl oz bottle. Pours light hazy golden with a big white head. Aroma of resinous hops, peach, sweet malt. Taste is medium sweet, medium bitter, peach, average IPA.

Poured from a 16oz can into a Duvel tulip glass. Packaged date reads "7/13/2015."

Aroma - Sweet, bright citrus (clementine, semi-ripe orange). Faintly floral. Earth

Appearance - Deep orange-yellow (light amber?). Creamy, white head. Thick lacing rims the top of the glass. 

Taste - Sweet, citrusy hops give-way to earthy, resiny hops. Citrus fruit rind also present. Hops, hops, hops. Orange and hop resin flavors linger on the pallet. 

Palate - Medium bodied, oily/ resiny at times. Dry finish.

Overall - I short changed this beer when I originally had it. Though the tall boy can is inviting, a glass is much more befitting. Let it breath. There’s too much citrus not to!

12 oz bottle, thanks Kelly! Bottled 3/13/15--uh oh. Aroma is doughy, perfumy, earthy, citrus--all pretty mild. Pours hazy orange with a medium bone-white head with decent retention; laces a little. Taste has a mild bitterness backed by a light candy sweetness. For the hype this has, this is vey understated. When I saw that bottling date, I was worried, but there are no off-notes, this beer does not taste old one bit. It’s just kind of boring. It tastes really good, no doubt, but I was expecting much more. It is tasty, though.
Nice balance of hops and malt. This is a definite must try for people that are new to the beer scene. Delicious and dependable.
Interesting IPA. Maltier than most. Distinctive amongst every other run of the mill IPA out there.

Poured it into a red cup which didn’t help me fully appreciate the aroma or get a good view of the beer. Does have a nice creamy white head. Piney with light grapefruit and floral notes. Nice malt backbone and bitter finish. Good stuff; wish I could get it at home!

Bottle. 5 months old, I’ll try to get a fresher one and rerate. Orange colour with white head. Caramel aroma. Sweet, caramel, malt taste, some fruitness and citric taste. Medium body.
Another bottle, 2 months old. Orange colour with white head. Caramel and malt, floral aroma. Sweet, hoppy, fruity, citric, floral caramel, malt taste,  taste. Medium body.

This is my favorite IPA! Check it out at Pinocchio’s in Media, PA. They have it in 16 oz cans. Also, Bell Bev in South Philly sometimes has it on sale. If you like IPAs, it will surely make your top five. Cheers!

Bottle into tulip. Decent white head on hazy Amber beer. Pleasant enticing aroma of resin, yeast, bread that is most pronounced when first poured but goes as the head dissipates. strong sharp hop on the front which is mellowed by malt but finishes w a bitter hop aftertaste. Palate is wrecked a bit by the hop overload. Can't taste much as a result - some pine, floral notes. First few sips were quite nice but it is getting harder to drink the more I try. Will be a struggle to get through it. I can see why all the hop heads give it a good rating but i will not be returning to this one.

Excellent balance between floral and piney hips and a bready malt backbone. Very clean. One of the best shelf IPAs around.

A staple from Michigan. Great hop character and an easy favorite ipa especially given its easy availability.
Aroma of grass, flowers and spices. Spicy very balanced taste. Nothing sticks out. A little alcohol in the finish. A little boring.

Nice ballance of hop and malt. Slightly hazy golden with light lasting head. Smooth intro perfume hop middle malt ballanced finished.
A staple in my fridge and in my heart. A perfectly balanced IPA unlike a lot of these newcomers - malt backbone supported by a crisp long lasting finish of citrus/piney hop profile.

On tap.
Clear Golden pour, small White head.
Slightly sour hoppy Nose, hoppy taste with a lightly bitter finish. 
Medium body, average carbonation.

Pours a froth, beautiful bubble durchzogen white head, with a sunny amber, slighty hazy color.

Smells of grass driven orange, coated up by bitter lemon zest. Citrus peel grows stronger, as the beer warms up with unripe, sour kiwi, as well as apricot skin. Still, the maltiness is very strong on the nose, adding a note of earth and rock sugar to the hops.

Has a medium carbonation, exhibiting a refreshing, hop forward beer, with lots of exotic fruits to it, as well a prominent malt backbone.

Begins with sweeter, biscuity malts, revealing toffee infused rye bread, giving the malts a pleasant depth, balancing the well pronounced hops easily. Reveals surprisingly sweet toffee malts, which get joined by far reaching lime juice, which lends the beer a profound, bitter refreshment. The hops get enhanced by dried tangerine peel and apple stones, providing an aggressive dryness, which features a worthy counterpart to the well developed malt backbone, staying on the tongue for a longer while.

Well balanced, easy drinking ipa which isn’t convincing only for its hoppy part, but also for its eigenständig malty part, adding to the hops, while balancing them, without cutting them short in any way. Old school ipa, with a straight forward, long lasting hoppiness, providing a great fruiti- and dryness, successfully coated up by the malts.

Poured from the bottle. Nice head, great aroma, mostly citrus. Flavor has a very nice bitterness to it. This beer surprised us in Arizona! Can’t believe we nabbed a 100 ipa. But it’s worth every point
